column1: BOSTON --   When Wei - Yin Chen saw right fielder Nick Markakis make a diving grab in the fifth inning
column3: he thought about a perfect game . 	 Chen did n't permit a runner until the sixth
column4: Adam Jones helped provide an early cushion and the Baltimore Orioles beat the Boston Red Sox 10 - 6 Wednesday for a three - game sweep . 	 The Orioles took an 8 - 0 lead in the fifth . Markakis robbed Allen Craig with a catch in the gap for the second out in the bottom of the inning . 	 " Of course it still crosses your mind
column5: a perfect game is still very difficult to do
column6: so I tried to concentrate on each at - bat
column7: " Chen said through a translator . 	 Dan Butler then doubled off the Green Monster with one out in the sixth
column8: ending the pitching drama . 	 " Wei - Yin was tough
column9: " Orioles manager Buck Showalter said . " I love the way he attacked with the lead
column10: pitched real well with the lead . A lot of people nitpick around . He had some depth on his off - speed stuff again . " 	 Caleb Joseph homered and drove in three runs and Ryan Flaherty got a career - high four hits as Baltimore won for the 11th time in 14 games and maintained its double - digit lead atop the AL East . 	 Chen ( 15 - 4 ) gave up one run and three hits in seven innings
column11: striking out four without a walk . The left - hander felt throwing strikes early in counts was important . 	 " I was able to get ahead of the hitters and they were more aggressive than they should be
column12: that 's why I was so efficient
column13: " he said . 	 The Red Sox scored five runs in the ninth
column14: but it was n't nearly enough after Chen shut them down . 	 " Stayed out of the middle of the plate . He 's been a guy that notoriously is effective against us
column15: " Boston manager John Farrell said . " He pitches right - handers in . He 's got multiple secondary pitches that he can go to
column16: but I think more than anything it 's the consistent location that he shows . " 	 Darren O'Day got the last out with two runners on for his third save . 	 Brandon Workman ( 1 - 9 ) lost his ninth straight decision since winning at Baltimore on June 10 . 	 Jones ' two - run double highlighted a six - run third
column17: and Joseph hit a two - run drive in the fifth . Jones and Joseph each had three hits . 	 Chen improved to 12 - 2 in his last 21 starts . The only run off the left - hander scored on a home run by Xander Bogaerts . 	 Carlos Rivero hit his first career homer
column18: a three - run shot off Joe Saunders
column19: in the ninth . 	 The Orioles combined six hits -- two by Flaherty -- two walks and Rivero 's throwing error from third base for their burst in the third . Alejandro De Aza
column20: Joseph and Flaherty each had RBI singles and Steve Pearce drew a bases - loaded walk . 	 NOT SO FAST 	 With their magic number in single digits for clinching the AL East and a 10 - game homestand coming up
column21: the Orioles can possibly clinch at home . Showalter was n't about to think that far ahead . " If that comes to be the potential for that to happen
column23: if we 're fortunate to have that day happen
column24: then we can talk about it
column25: " he said . " We 've got a lot of roads to cross . " 	 A PAIR OF SINGLES IN THIRD 	 Flaherty became the third Orioles player to get two hits in an inning this season . Joseph did it Aug. 31 against Minnesota . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Orioles : SS J.J. Hardy missed his fifth straight game with lower back spasms . The hope is he 'll be ready to play in Friday 's doubleheader against the Yankees . " He 's feeling good
column26: " Showalter said . " We 'll have a better idea ( Thursday ) . " 	 Red Sox : Farrell said after the game that 2B Dustin Pedroia is done for the season was scheduled to have surgery Thursday for soreness in his left wrist and hand . " He 's going to have a procedure done here tomorrow by Dr. Leibman in Boston that will address what he 's dealing with right now
column27: " Farrell said . " I do n't know any more specifics than that
column28: but there will be certainly a follow - up after that 's completed tomorrow . " ... INF - OF Brock Holt missed his fifth straight because of illness
column29: but is expected to play in the upcoming series in Kansas City . 	 UP NEXT 	 Orioles : Off Thursday before opening a 10 - game homestand with a doubleheader against the Yankees on Friday . RHP Kevin Gausman ( 7 - 7

column1: WASHINGTON -- Fredi Gonzalez can not explain why the Braves have done so well against Stephen Strasburg . The Atlanta manager is just glad his team beat the Washington ace once again . 	 Aaron Harang outdueled Strasburg
column2: Justin Upton drove in three runs and the Braves avoided a series sweep with a 6 - 2 win over the Nationals on Wednesday . 	 The Braves snapped a three - game losing streak as Harang ( 11 - 10 ) held the NL East leaders to one unearned run over seven innings . Upton 's RBI single in the sixth broke a 1 - all tie
column3: and he added a two - run double off reliever Ryan Mattheus during a three - run seventh . B.J. Upton homered for Atlanta . 	 " This is a big win
column4: " Gonzalez said . " This is a win that you look forward to maybe ( tacking ) on three or four more in a row and get us back on top of the wild - card mix . " 	 Strasburg ( 11 - 11 ) allowed three runs and seven hits in six innings . Bryce Harper homered for Washington
column5: which had won three straight . 	 Washington won the opening two games of the series . Atlanta trails by eight games in the division . 	 " If we came in here and got swept it 's ( going to ) leave a sour note in everybody 's mouth
column6: " Harang said . " We ca n't focus on the division as much as the wild card right now . " 	 Success against Atlanta has been historically difficult for Washington and Strasburg . 	 The Nationals dropped to 6 - 10 this season against the Braves
column7: though they had won five of the previous seven games . They have not swept Atlanta in Washington since 2008 . 	 Strasburg has not earned a win against the Braves since Aug. 21
column8: 2012 . In four starts this season against Atlanta
column9: the righty is 0 - 2 with a 7.18 ERA . 	 " It 's one of those things you ca n't explain
column10: " Gonzalez stated . " You really ca n't . ... Trying to explain it would n't sound very smart . " 	 Strasburg entered with a 3 - 0 record in his previous five starts . The NL strikeout leader fanned eight
column11: but lost for the first time since August 8 . 	 " I felt great out there
column12: " Strasburg said . " I felt like I was hitting my spots
column15: and that 's the ballgame . " 	 Harang struggled recently
column16: going 0 - 3 with a 7.98 ERA in his last three starts . That version did n't show Wednesday . He struck out nine and surrendered six hits while improving to 2 - 0 with an 0.90 ERA versus Washington this season . 	 The 4:07 p.m. start benefitted both starters . Shadows initially stretched across home plate . As the sun dipped the shadows receded and the Braves
column17: " we were able to see the baseball
column18: " said Freddie Freeman
column19: who had an RBI . Washington never did solve Harang . 	 " Today is pretty tough peeping out there . Shadows are tough
column20: " Nationals manager Matt Williams said . " Breaking ball especially
column22: is difficult . And change of speed . But ( Harang ) can do that really well
column23: regardless of shadow or not . " 	 Kevin Frandsen had three singles for the Nationals . 	 LET 'S GO TO THE VIDEOTAPE 	 Harang credited re - watching previous starts along with recent bullpen sessions for his turnaround performance . " The ball was n't coming out of my hand the way I wanted it to . I was really having to force things . ... I went out there and felt good today . " 	 CALL OFF THE SEARCH PARTY 	 Making his first appearance since Sept. 5
column24: Nationals reliever Rafael Soriano allowed two hits in one inning . Soriano has been removed from the closer 's role after blowing saves chances in his previous two appearances . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Braves : C Evan Gattis ( strep throat ) returned to the locker room after spending the previous two days at the team 's hotel . Gonzalez kept him out of Wednesday 's lineup and said Gattis will likely serve as Atlanta 's designated hitter for the upcoming series in Texas . 	 Nationals : 3B Anthony Rendon ( illness ) and SS Ian Desmond ( back tightness ) were kept out of the starting lineup . Desmond left Tuesday 's game after five innings with back tightness . Williams said the shortstop could have played Wednesday . 	 UP NEXT 	 Braves : LHP Alex Wood ( 10 - 10

column1: DETROIT -- James Shields was acquired two offseasons ago to pitch in games like this for Kansas City . 	 With the Royals trying to avoid a sweep in their biggest series in years
column2: the 32 - year - old right - hander delivered . 	 " You do n't earn a nickname like ' Big Game James ' for nothing
column3: " manager Ned Yost said . " Games do n't come much bigger than this . " 	 Shields allowed two hits over seven innings in another terrific performance
column4: and Kansas City edged Detroit 3 - 0 on Wednesday night to take a one - game lead over the Tigers atop the AL Central . Detroit had won the first two games of the series to pull into a virtual tie for first in the division . 	 The teams have a three - game series in Kansas City that starts Sept. 19 . 	 " It 's definitely a game that we needed
column6: but I think every game from here on out is pretty crucial
column7: " Shields said . " We took a couple tough losses there
column9: but we 're having fun right now and enjoying the moment . " 	 Shields ( 14 - 7 ) gave up a single to Ian Kinsler leading off the first . Then he picked off Kinsler -- and retired every other batter he faced until another Detroit single in the seventh . The Tigers put two on that inning
column10: but Shields worked out of the jam . 	 Kelvin Herrera pitched the eighth and Wade Davis finished for his third save . 	 Rick Porcello ( 15 - 11 ) pitched well for the Tigers
column11: but Kansas City pushed across two runs in the fourth on RBI singles by Salvador Perez and Lorenzo Cain . 	 Alcides Escobar added a sacrifice fly in the ninth . 	 Shields was acquired in December 2012 in a trade that sent top prospect Wil Myers to Tampa Bay . Myers won Rookie of the Year honors last season
column12: but now Shields has helped put the Royals in contention for their first postseason appearance since 1985 . 	 " The only thing I 've been telling guys is just stay relaxed and have fun
column14: who pitched in the postseason for Tampa Bay in 2008
column15: 2010 and 2011 . " This is why we play the game . " 	 He came within two outs of a shutout in New York on Friday in a 1 - 0 win over the Yankees
column16: and the Tigers did n't fare any better against him . Shields struck out eight and walked one on Wednesday
column17: throwing 98 pitches . Torii Hunter 's comebacker hit Shields in the back of his right leg in the first
column18: but the Kansas City starter was able to continue . 	 The game was delayed 42 minutes by rain at the start
column19: and in the fourth it was raining hard enough to send fans toward the concourse
column20: but there were no more delays . 	 RALLY HALTED 	 In the seventh
column21: Hunter managed a single and Miguel Cabrera walked
column22: but Shields retired Victor Martinez on a deep fly and struck out J.D. Martinez . 	 " That 's pretty typical of him . He goes out and he pitches like that for 200 innings every year . That 's what he does
column23: " Kinsler said . " Rick threw the ball really well
column24: but we did n't create any offense
column25: and that 's the game . " 	 TOUGH LOSS 	 Porcello struck out four of the first five Kansas City batters . He allowed two runs and seven hits in 6 2/3 innings
column26: striking out seven without a walk . 	 He allowed consecutive singles to Josh Willingham
column27: Eric Hosmer and Perez with one out in the fourth
column28: and Cain 's two - out single made it 2 - 0 . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Royals : All - Star closer Greg Holland sat out again
column29: despite the tight score in the late innings . He has n't pitched since Sept. 3 because of a triceps issue . 	 " Greg felt fine today
column30: " Yost said . " My whole mindset was
column31: I was going to go up to the point where Greg said
column33: I do n't feel anything ' -- and then give him another day . " 	 Tigers : RHP Joakim Soria ( left oblique strain ) was activated from the disabled list before the game . He allowed a run in the ninth . ... Left - handed reliever Phil Coke left in the eighth with a muscle spasm in his lower back after being unable to field Hosmer 's bunt . column1: PHILADELPHIA -- There has been no slowing down Andrew McCutchen or the Pittsburgh Pirates lately . 	 The reigning National League MVP hit the first inside - the - park homer of his career
column2: and the Pirates protected their lead in the wild - card race
column3: beating the Philadelphia Phillies 6 - 3 on Wednesday night . 	 Russell Martin also homered in the fifth inning
column4: and the Pirates ' bullpen helped secure the team 's sixth victory in seven games . McCutchen tied the score when he scored standing up after his drive off the wall in straightaway center field . 	 " With ( McCutchen 's ) speed
column6: " it was an easy finish for him . " 	 The star slugger said he knew he had an inside - the - park homer when the ball first struck the wall . 	 " It 's brick
column7: so anything coming that hard is going to come off it and go that way
column8: " he said . " I knew when it hit the wall that I had a good chance . " 	 The last - place Phillies have had a difficult time trying to contain McCutchen
column9: who is 18 - for-36 in his past 10 games against Pittsburgh 's in - state rivals . 	 Two batters after McCutchen 's electrifying homer
column10: Martin gave the Pirates the lead for good with a more - traditional long ball . He sent his ninth homer of the season a few rows deep into the center - field seats
column11: putting Pittsburgh ahead 4 - 3 . 	 Pittsburgh starter Vance Worley ( 7 - 4 )
column12: who pitched two seasons for the Phillies
column13: won in his return to Philadelphia after being traded in 2012 . 	 The Pirates ' bullpen
column14: which entered with the NL 's fifth - best ERA
column15: kept Philadelphia hitless for four innings . Bobby LaFromboise
column16: John Holdzkom and Tony Watson pitched clean innings
column17: and Mark Melancon did the same in the ninth to convert his 28th save in 32 opportunities . 	 Hurdle said Worley had " inconsistent command
column18: " forcing him to rely on his bullpen to pick him up . 	 Worley agreed with his manager 's assessment . 	 " Stuff was sloppy and did the opposite of what I wanted the ball to do
column19: " he said . " It seemed like my four - seam ( fastball ) was sinking
column21: and my curveballs were nowhere in the zone . And if I threw my cutter right
column22: it was 5 feet short . I just had to keep battling and trust what I had and trust my defense behind me . " 	 Cody Asche doubled and scored two runs for the Phillies
column23: who have lost three of four . 	 Phillies starter Jerome Williams ( 3 - 1 ) helped Philadelphia more from the batter 's box than from the pitcher 's mound . The right - hander 's two - run single in the fourth doubled his career RBI total to four and gave the Phillies a 3 - 2 lead . Williams ' hit was the last of the night for Philadelphia . 	 In the fifth
column25: who finished with three RBIs
column26: homered off Williams to erase Pittsburgh 's deficit . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Pirates : Third baseman Pedro Alvarez has been diagnosed with a stress reaction in the fourth metatarsal of his left foot

column1: TORONTO --   Blue Jays pitcher Drew Hutchison packed plenty of punch against the punchless Chicago Cubs . 	 Hutchison matched his career - high with 10 strikeouts in 6 1/3 innings
column2: Dioner Navarro had two hits and two RBIs
column3: and the Toronto Blue Jays completed a three - game sweep with an 11 - 1 win over the Cubs on Wednesday night . 	 Navarro said Hutchison was " outstanding " in improving to 3 - 0 with a 0.96 ERA and 26 strikeouts in his past four home starts . 	 " He utilized the strike zone
column4: " Navarro said . " We knew we were playing a free - swinging team
column5: so get ahead and expand . He did a great job of that . " 	 Hutchison ( 10 - 11 ) allowed one run and four hits in his second career 10 - strikeout game -- both this season . He also did it against Milwaukee on July 1 . 	 " My slider has been good to both sides of the plate lately
column6: " Hutchison said . " I think that 's been a big reason why I 've pitched well . " 	 Jorge Soler 's seventh - inning homer provided the only run for the Cubs
column7: who matched a season - worst with their sixth straight loss . At 64 - 82
column8: they are ensured of a fifth straight losing season . It is the first time they have had five consecutive seasons below .500 since six straight from 1978 - 83 . 	 Chicago has been outscored 48 - 10 during its losing streak . 	 " We 've hit a skid lately
column9: " Cubs starter Kyle Hendricks said . " We 've got to do something to get out of it . " 	 Jose Bautista went 0 for 2 with two walks
column10: snapping his hitting streak at 13 games
column11: but the Blue Jays improved to 7 - 2 in September . 	 Javier Baez drew a one - out walk in the first and had rounded third on Luis Valbuena 's double when he saw the stop sign from third base coach Gary Jones . Baez tried to retreat but was thrown out at third by Navarro . 	 Chicago did n't get another runner until Chris Coghlan 's two - out double in the sixth snapped a streak of 15 consecutive outs . 	 Leading 1 - 0 on Anthony Gose 's sacrifice fly
column12: Toronto chased right - hander Kyle Hendricks with a three - run sixth . Hendricks ( 6 - 2 ) allowed four runs and six hits in 5 2/3 innings to lose for the first time since July 27 against St. Louis . 	 The Blue Jays added five more in the seventh against a trio of relievers
column13: and Canadian rookie Dalton Pompey made it 10 - 1 with a groundout in the eighth
column14: his first career RBI . 	 " I 'll never forget it
column15: " Pompey said . 	 ROTATION SHUFFLE 	 Blue Jays manager John Gibbons said the team is considering pushing rookie RHP Marcus Stroman back two days to allow Mark Buehrle to start against the Rays on Sunday . Buehrle is 2 - 0 with a 2.08 ERA in five starts against Tampa Bay this season . Stroman
column16: who 's 1 - 1 with a 5.73 ERA in two starts against the Rays
column17: would face Baltimore instead . 	 DIFFERENT KIND OF CUBS 	 After batting practice
column18: the Blue Jays returned to their clubhouse and cavorted with a baby lion and a baby tiger
column19: with several players taking photos with the animals and posting them on social media . Bautista posed holding the tiger in his hands
column20: while Edwin Encarnacion sat on a clubhouse couch with the tiger on his lap . " I got videos
column22: " Navarro said . " My kids are pretty jealous . " 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Cubs : 1B Anthony Rizzo ( back ) took batting practice on the field for the first time since being injured on Aug. 26 . He homered into the center field seats on his final swing . 	 Blue Jays : Navarro took a foul tip off the top of his left knee in the sixth . He was attended to by the trainer but remained in the game . 	 UP NEXT 	 Cubs : Chicago is off Thursday before opening a three - game series at Pittsburgh on Friday
column23: with LHP Tsuyoshi Wada ( 4 - 2 ) facing Pirates RHP Gerrit Cole ( 8 - 5 ) . Wada faced Pittsburgh in his most recent start
column25: but left after 3 1/3 innings with a sore left calf . 	 Blue Jays : Toronto is off Thursday before opening a three - game series against Tampa Bay on Friday . Blue Jays LHP J.A. Happ ( 9 - 9 ) will face Rays RHP Nathan Karns ( season debut ) . Happ will be making his first start against the Rays this season . 	 Detroit got a jump - start on the winter signings
column26: landing lefty Eduardo Rodriguez . We break down the deal . 	 In a free - agent field filled with future Hall of Famers
column27: Detroit added one of the most undervalued pitchers available this winter . 	 Joon Lee breaks down how Eduardo Rodriguez signing with Detroit affects the Tigers and Red Sox . column1: CINCINNATI --   Alfredo Simon usually takes a strike before taking a swing . The Cincinnati right - hander was more aggressive
column2: and it paid off against the St. Louis Cardinals . 	 The Reds starter doubled on the first pitch of his first at bat and then swung at the first pitch of his second plate appearance before slashing another two - bagger that drove in the go - ahead run of a 4 - 2 Reds win on Wednesday night . 	 " Sometimes
column3: ( manager Bryan Price ) tells me to take a strike
column5: the fastball I get on the first pitch is the only chance I have to get a hit
column7: who was hitting .098 going into the game . 	 Simon shook off a rough start but lasted seven innings
column8: and Ryan Ludwick hit a solo home run to help the Reds win back - to - back games for the first time since Aug. 27 - 28 against the Chicago Cubs . The Central Division - leading Cardinals had n't sustained consecutive defeats since a four - game losing streak from Aug. 26 - 30 . 	 " He was a little erratic early
column10: " Price said of Simon . 	 Simon ( 14 - 10 ) allowed five hits and two runs with three walks and five strikeouts for his second win in eight decisions over 11 starts since the All - Star break . 	 " I gave up the two runs in the first inning
column12: " Simon said . " Everything was working . " 	 Sam LeCure and Ryan Dennick pitched the eighth
column13: and Aroldis Chapman worked a perfect ninth for his 32nd save . 	 Terry Lyons ( 0 - 4 ) took the loss after Cardinals starter John Lackey was ejected in the third inning for arguing balls and strikes . 	 Plate umpire Tom Hallion ejected Lackey four pitches into the third inning . 	 " Lackey was warned to quit arguing balls and strikes
column15: " Hallion said . 	 The ejection caught Lackey by surprise . 	 " I did n't say any cuss words toward him
column16: " Lackey said . " He saw my mouth moving and threw me out . It was unexpected
column17: for sure . I 've been thrown out a few times throwing balls at people
column18: but never for something like this " 	 With the game tied 2 - 2
column19: Jay Bruce led off the Reds ' fourth inning with a bloop single . Simon
column20: who entered with one career double
column21: went the opposite way to drive in Bruce with the go - ahead run . 	 Brandon Phillips added a bases - loaded
column22: run - scoring single in the fifth to make it 4 - 2 . 	 Simon retired the first two batters of the game before the Cardinals scored two runs . Matt Holliday walked and scored from first on Matt Adams ' double . Oscar Taveras followed with a run - scoring single . 	 Todd Frazier drove in Chris Heisey with a single in the first
column23: and Ludwick tied it for the Reds in the second with his ninth homer and first since Aug. 17 -- a 374 - foot shot into the left - field seats . 	 QUICK PITCH 	 Lackey was ejected for the fourth time in his career and first since 2009 when he was with the Angels and was ejected two pitches into a game for throwing at Texas ' Ian Kinsler . 	 DONE DEAL 	 The Reds acquired from Milwaukee minor - league RHP Kevin Shackelford and RHP Barrett Astin on Wednesday as the two players to be named in the Aug. 31 trade that sent RHP Jonathan Broxton to the Brewers . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Cardinals : Manager Mike Matheny got no argument from SS Jhonny Peralta when the veteran was given Wednesday off . Peralta missed just three of St. Louis ' first 145 games . " He wants to finish strong
column24: " Matheny said . " He 's answered the bell . " 	 Reds : RHP Pedro Villareal 's status remained day - to - day after he was hit in the right forearm by Holliday 's sharp one - hopper in the ninth inning of Monday 's 5 - 0 loss . 	 UP NEXT 	 Cardinals : Lance Lynn tries to improve to 4 - 0 in four 2014 starts against Cincinnati in Thursday 's series finale . 	 Reds : Johnny Cueto will look to avoid dropping to 0 - 3 in three starts this season against St. Louis . 	 Check out some of the most electric moments from Vladimir Guerrero Jr. 's career . column1: NEW YORK --   Rafael Montero found pitching in the majors easier the third time around . 	 The rookie right - hander earned his first career win
column2: Eric Young Jr. went 3 for 3 with an RBI triple and the suddenly surging New York Mets beat the Colorado Rockies 2 - 0 Wednesday night for their fourth consecutive victory . 	 Montero ( 1 - 3 ) returned from the minors and allowed three hits over 5 1/3 innings in his seventh big league start . This is his third stint with New York this season . 	 " Thank God that it happened
column3: " Montero said through a translator . " If I can continue to pitch the way I pitched tonight
column4: hopefully more to come . " 	 Dilson Herrera scored twice and Juan Lagares had a sacrifice fly for the Mets
column5: who have won seven of eight . New York finished a three - game sweep of last - place Colorado
column6: winning the final two by identical scores behind Montero and fellow rookie Jacob deGrom . 	 It marks the first time the Mets have thrown consecutive shutouts since June 29 - 30
column7: 2012 . 	 Colorado was outscored 7 - 2 in the series and has lost six straight games at Citi Field . 	 " We pitched very well this series and Tyler ( Matzek ) threw the ball very well again tonight
column8: " Rockies manager Walt Weiss said . " You score two runs in three games and you 're not going to win . " 	 Montero did not give up a hit until Matzek 's fifth - inning double . He struck out seven and walked two
column9: throwing 106 pitches in his first major league start since Aug. 17 . 	 New York remained 5 1/2 games behind Pittsburgh for the second NL wild card . 	 " I 'm very pleased
column10: " Mets manager Terry Collins said . " I think when you walk through the clubhouse doors right now in September
column11: even though you 're looking at a wild card
column12: you 're still playing for something . And that 's the only way to go in every day
column13: to know that it 's fun to go out there and compete . " 	 Herrera worked a two - out walk against Matzek ( 5 - 10 ) in the second . Young followed with a drive to right - center that just glanced off the glove of center fielder Drew Stubbs . 	 The triple was Young 's fourth of the season and his first extra - base hit -- and RBI -- since Aug. 24 . His three hits matched a season high . 	 " Just a matter of if he was going to try to make a catch for it
column14: " Young said . " I knew if it got past him
column15: I was already going for three . And if he caught it
column16: then tough luck . " 	 The Rockies threatened in the sixth after a leadoff double by Stubbs and a single by Justin Morneau put runners at second and third . Montero struck out Nolan Arenado on a high fastball
column17: the last batter he faced . 	 Dario Alvarez retired Chris Dickerson on a dribbler in front of the plate
column18: and Carlos Torres induced a popup to shortstop from Michael McKenry . 	 Torres gave up a hit in the seventh
column19: Jeurys Familia worked the eighth and Jenrry Mejia rebounded from a shaky outing Tuesday to finish the four - hitter . 	 Mejia 's perfect ninth gave him his 25th save in 28 opportunities . He became the youngest Mets pitcher to save 25 games in a season . 	 " Confidence is up amongst the players
column20: " Young said . " It 's needed going into the Washington series . We can really put a damper in some of their season as well as accelerate ourselves here in these last couple of weeks . " 	 New York added a run in the seventh after Herrera drew his second walk from Matzek and went to second on Young 's single . Pinch - hitter Josh Satin walked
column21: and Herrera scored on Lagares ' fly to left . 	 Matzek gave up two runs on four hits and four walks in 6 1/3 innings . 	 HELLO AGAIN 	 With 3B David Wright ( shoulder ) sidelined for the rest of the season
column22: All - Star 2B Daniel Murphy made his first start at third for the Mets since July 21
column23: 2011 . It was Murphy 's 26th career start at third . Herrera stayed at second . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Rockies : OF Michael Cuddyer was rested by manager Walt Weiss after playing in back - to - back games following his activation from the disabled list . Cuddyer was placed on the 15 - day DL with a left hamstring strain on Aug. 24 . 	 Mets : OF Matt den Dekker ( left hand ) was held out of the lineup after being hit by a pitch Tuesday . Collins said den Dekker was still sore . 	 CAVE MAN 	 Rockies OF Charlie Blackmon spent time at the MLB Fan Cave on Wednesday and took " selfies " with New York City fans . 	 " I enjoyed it and I think the people I bumped into enjoyed it
column24: " he said . " I think it 's cool when fans can see what a player is like away from the field
column25: see what their personality is like and see that they 're actually relatable and that they 're not that different from many of the fans out there . " 	 Blackmon then took the No . 7 subway train to Citi Field . 	 " I enjoyed that
column26: " he added . " I feel real New Yorkey . I feel like a real city - dweller when I do that . " 	 PAYING TRIBUTE 	 Wright and Mets RHP Dillon Gee visited FDNY 288
column27: HazMat 1 in Maspeth on Wednesday . The firehouse
column28: located 5 miles from Citi Field
column29: lost 19 members on Sept. 11
column30: 2001 . Wright has visited a firehouse on or around Sept. 11 every year since his rookie season of 2004 . Gee 's father
column31: Kevin
column32: is a firefighter in Fort Worth
column33: Texas . 	 UP NEXT 	 Rockies : After a day off Thursday
column34: Colorado begins a three - game series Friday at first - place St. Louis . LHP Jorge De La Rosa ( 13 - 10
column35: 4.27 ERA ) faces Cardinals ace Adam Wainwright ( 17 - 9
column36: 2.62 ) . De La Rosa is 6 - 3 with a 4.71 ERA in 15 appearances ( nine starts ) against the Cardinals . 	 Mets : RHP Bartolo Colon ( 13 - 11
column37: 3.96 ) starts Thursday night in the opener of a four - game series against NL East - leading Washington . RHP Tanner Roark ( 12 - 10
column38: 2.97 ) goes for the Nationals . He is 3 - 0 with a 3.10 ERA against New York in four career appearances ( three starts ) . 	 Randy Arozarena celebrates with his family at home after learning he won the 2021 AL Rookie of the Year . 	 From MVP to Cy Young and more

column2: Texas -- Albert Pujols almost had consecutive triples after going more than four years without one . Instead
column3: he ended up with a chance to complete the first cycle of his career . 	 The Los Angeles slugger tried a little too hard in both cases and missed out . It did n't keep the Angels from adding to their big lead in the AL West . 	 Pujols tripled to open the scoring and finished a home run shy of the cycle
column4: rookie Matt Shoemaker had another strong start
column5: and the Angels beat the Texas Rangers 8 - 1 on Wednesday night . 	 " It would have been pretty cool
column6: " Pujols said . " It 's not easy . That 's why you do n't see it every day . Obviously
column7: everybody says the hardest part is to get that triple
column8: which I believe it is . " 	 The AL West - leading Angels ( 90 - 55 )
column9: who are nine games up on Oakland after the A 's lost at the Chicago White Sox
column10: were the first team in the majors to 90 wins with their season - high seventh straight victory . 	 Shoemaker ( 15 - 4 ) set a franchise rookie record for victories by winning his sixth straight decision . 	 Texas right - hander Nick Tepesch ( 4 - 10 ) has just one win in 12 starts . 	 Pujols ' first - inning triple made Mike Trout the sixth player in major league history to score 100 runs in three seasons before turning 23 . It was the first triple for Pujols since July 10
column12: when he played for St. Louis . 	 In the third
column13: Pujols ' fly ball eluded a leaping Michael Choice and caromed off the right - field wall . Choice ran down the ball and threw to Elvis Andrus
column14: who tagged Pujols trying to scramble back to second . 	 Pujols
column15: who playfully tugged at Andrus ' cap as he jogged back to the dugout
column16: had a single in the fifth . 	 The Rangers intentionally walked Trout to load the bases for Pujols in the sixth
column17: but he grounded into an inning - ending double play . Pujols reached on a throwing error by Andrus and scored in the eighth
column18: and then admittedly was swinging for the fences when he grounded out to Andrus in the ninth . 	 " I think everybody was aware
column19: " Angels manager Mike Scioscia said . " In the big picture
column20: I do n't think it 's one that he needs on his shelf
column21: but it would have been nice to see . " 	 Shoemaker
column22: who broke a rookie wins record tied most recently by Frank Tanana in 1974
column23: came close to pitching at least seven shutout innings for the fourth time in five starts . He came out after giving up Ryan Rua 's RBI single with two outs in the seventh . 	 " I think Shoe is one of the big reasons why we 're even contending
column24: " Scioscia said . " When he got his chance to get in the rotation
column25: to do what he did is spectacular for us . " 	 SELECT 100 CLUB 	 Trout reached base three times and scored twice to push his season total to 101 runs . The other five players to score 100 runs in three seasons before turning 23 were Mel Ott
column26: Buddy Lewis
column27: Ted Williams
column28: Vada Pinson and Alex Rodriguez . 	 REVOLVING DOOR 	 Interim Texas manager Tim Bogar has used at least five pitchers in four of his five games since replacing Ron Washington . He made three pitching changes in a seven - run eighth inning for the Angels on Tuesday . He used six pitchers for the first time Wednesday
column29: and the Angels scored five runs in the last three innings . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Angels : Josh Hamilton missed his sixth consecutive game with a sore right shoulder . He took two more injections Tuesday and woke up sore Wednesday . He hopes the injections will lead to dramatic improvement in the next couple of days
column30: but there is no timetable for his return . 	 Rangers : C Robinson Chirinos could be back behind the plate Thursday night after missing nine games with neck stiffness . ... Bogar says it is likely OF Jake Smolinski ( broken left foot ) will play again this season . He has been on the disabled list since July 25 . 	 UP NEXT 	 Angels : RHP Cory Rasmus ( 3 - 1
column31: 2.81 ERA ) will make his third straight start after 24 relief appearances to start the season . He threw three scoreless innings in a 2 - 0 win over Oakland on Aug. 30 before giving up two runs in 1 2/3 innings in an 8 - 5 win over Minnesota last week . 	 Rangers : Rookie RHP Nick Martinez ( 3 - 10
column32: 5.03 ) is looking for his first win at home after nine previous appearances
column33: including seven starts . He has a 6.81 ERA at home . He has allowed six hits in five straight starts
column34: the second Texas pitcher to do that ( Charlie Hough in 1982 ) . 	 Detroit got a jump - start on the winter signings

column1: CHICAGO --   Everything was going just fine for the Oakland Athletics . And then ? 	 " The circus came to town
column2: " Josh Donaldson said . 	 That 's one way to look at it . 	 Avisail Garcia drove in two runs with a bases - loaded single in the eighth inning
column3: and the Chicago White Sox beat the struggling Athletics 2 - 1 on Wednesday night . 	 Oakland was in line for the win after Jeff Samardzija threw seven scoreless innings
column4: and Adam Dunn singled in a run against his former team . 	 Instead
column5: the A 's lost for the 10th time in 13 games because the bullpen failed again to protect a lead . 	 Luke Gregerson ( 4 - 4 ) came on in the eighth
column6: and things quickly fell apart . It was the third time in four games that the Athletics ' relievers blew a lead . 	 Gregerson gave up a leadoff single to Carlos Sanchez
column7: and first baseman Nate Freiman threw wildly trying to force pinch - runner Leury Garcia at second after fielding Adam Eaton 's grounder . 	 The runners moved to second and third with one out when Gregerson bounced an 0 - 2 pitch to Jose Abreu before striking him out . He intentionally walked Conor Gillaspie to load the bases
column8: and Garcia lined a pitch up the middle for a two - run single that made it 2 - 1 . 	 The late rally made a winner of Zach Putnam ( 5 - 3 )
column9: who pitched a scoreless inning . Jake Petricka worked the ninth for his 12th save in 15 chances . 	 " It does a lot for us
column10: " Eaton said . " It really does . We want to show we 're not dead . The White Sox are here to stay . We want to be better next year
column11: and we 're going to continue to push to be better . It starts with this month . " 	 Samardzija looked sharp in his first start in Chicago since the Cubs traded him to Oakland on July 5 . He gave up six hits
column12: struck out six and walked two . 	 " They made me battle out there
column15: " Samardzija said . " So I was really grinding out there . " 	 White Sox rookie Chris Bassitt was almost as good . 	 In his second major league start
column16: the right - hander gave up one run and five hits . He left to loud cheers after Derek Norris led off the seventh with a broken - bat single . 	 Dunn
column17: recently acquired from the White Sox
column18: gave Oakland a 1 - 0 lead with two out in the fourth when he drove in Coco Crisp with a single past a diving Gillaspie at third . It looked as though that would be enough before the game turned in the eighth . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Athletics : C John Jaso remains out indefinitely with a concussion after visiting a specialist on Wednesday . Oakland manager Bob Melvin was hoping he would be cleared to return after seeing Dr. Micky Collins in Pittsburgh . Instead
column19: Melvin said Jaso will return to Oakland and stay away from baseball activities for at least a few days . ... Closer Sean Doolittle appears close to returning from a strained muscle in the rib area . He threw a side session Wednesday
column20: and Melvin said he could be activated on Friday . ... OF Craig Gentry was improving but still was feeling symptoms after leaving Tuesday 's game with a concussion
column21: Melvin said . 	 White Sox : Retiring slugger Paul Konerko hopes to return from a broken bone in his left hand next week . He said he might take some swings on Friday and hit some balls over the weekend . He thinks he will be ready to play during a nine - game trip to Kansas City
column22: Tampa Bay and Detroit that starts next week . 	 UP NEXT 	 Chris Sale ( 11 - 3
column25: 3.42 ) pitches for Oakland as the White Sox and Athletics wrap up their four - game series . Kazmir got back on track in his last start even though he did n't figure in the decision
column26: allowing three runs in 6 1/3 innings after giving up 13 runs in his previous two outings . 	 FOR THE HIGHLIGHT REEL 	 Donaldson made a terrific grab at third when he leaped to his left to snag Gillaspie 's liner in the fourth inning
column27: and White Sox left fielder Jordan Danks made a neat catch in the seventh when he raced in and dove to rob Jed Lowrie . 	 From MVP to Cy Young and more

column1: MILWAUKEE --   Matt Clark 's first home run of his career is something he 'll likely never forget . Or maybe he already did . 	 Clark hit his first homer
column2: Wily Peralta pitched into the seventh inning
column3: and the Milwaukee Brewers beat the Miami Marlins 4 - 1 Wednesday night . 	 " I do n't really remember much of it
column4: " Clark said . " I think they gave me a concussion when I walked through the dugout . It was definitely an awesome feeling . " 	 Peralta ( 16 - 10 ) gave up one earned run and five hits in 6 2/3 innings to help Milwaukee snap a four - game losing streak and win for just the second time in its last 15 games . The right - hander also had an RBI for the Brewers
column5: who remained 1 1/2 games behind Pittsburgh for the second wild - card spot . 	 " I really liked the way Wily came out and threw the ball
column6: " Milwaukee manager Ron Roenicke said . " He set the tone . His fastballs were outstanding . He threw more change - ups today . That 's the best change - up I 've seen him have . " 	 Francisco Rodriguez got the last three outs to reach 40 saves for the fifth time in his career . 	 Miami 's Jarred Cosart ( 4 - 2 ) allowed an earned run and four hits in six innings
column7: striking out seven . He had won his last four decisions . 	 Marcell Ozuna hit his 22nd home run of the season to lead off the seventh for Miami . 	 Rodriguez
column8: who gave up three runs in the ninth in a 6 - 3 loss Tuesday
column9: last topped the 40 - save mark in 2008 when he set a major league record with 62 while with the Los Angeles Angels . 	 The Brewers took a 1 - 0 lead in the third when Jean Segura reached second base when shortstop Adeiny Hechavarria fielded his ground ball and threw it over the head of first baseman Garrett Jones . As Segura went to second
column10: Miami thought he failed to touch first . But when Cosart threw the ball to first to appeal the play
column11: Segura took third and scored on the next pitch on Peralta 's sacrifice fly . 	 Official scorer Tim O'Driscoll initially ruled Segura 's advancement to third as a fielder 's choice . After discussing the play with the Elias Sports Bureau
column13: he changed it to a stolen base . 	 " That was on my shoulders for kind of lobbing the ball over there and giving Segura a chance to get to third
column14: " Cosart said . 	 Added Miami manager Mike Redmond : " That was a crazy play
column16: a September call - up making his second start
column17: got his first career RBI on a sacrifice fly in the fourth . He then led off the bottom of the seventh with his homer to right for a 3 - 1 lead . 	 SURPRISE CALL 	 Shortly after Jonathan Lucroy became the third Brewers player all - time to hit 50 doubles in a season
column18: he was thrown out at the plate by left fielder Christian Yelich on a single by Aramis Ramirez in the first inning . Not only did the fans loudly cheer when the replay was shown
column19: nearly every Miami player returned to the infield . Home plate umpire Dan Bellino
column20: while the play was still under review
column21: even tossed the ball back to Cosart as he walked to the mound . But shortly after
column22: Lucroy was still ruled out . 	 TRANSACTIONS 	 Milwaukee recalled relief pitcher Rob Wooten from Triple - A Nashville prior to the game . He was 1 - 4 with a 4.59 ERA with the Brewers this season . ... The Brewers sent minor - league right - handed pitchers Kevin Shackelford and Barrett Astin to Cincinnati to complete the Aug. 31 trade for pitcher Jonathan Broxton from the Reds . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Marlins : Henderson Alvarez will start Friday and Brad Penny has been moved to the bullpen . Alvarez left his start on Sept. 1 because of a left oblique strain . 	 Brewers : Ryan Braun did not start for the second game in a row . The right fielder has been dealing with an injury to his right thumb that spread to his hand . 	 UP NEXT 	 Marlins : Nathan Eovaldi ( 6 - 10 ) is 0 - 4 with a 4.91 ERA in his career against Milwaukee . 	 Brewers : Mike Fiers ( 5 - 2 ) is 0 - 2 in his career against the Marlins . column1: SAN FRANCISCO -- The Giants have their swagger back . They 're also piling up the wins at AT&T Park again
column2: just as they did early in the season when they owned baseball 's best record for a while . 	 With a little more than two weeks left in the regular season
column3: manager Bruce Bochy 's club is heating up at the right time . 	 Four pitchers combined on a two - hitter
column4: and Gregor Blanco had an RBI double as part of a four - run seventh inning that sent San Francisco to a 5 - 0 victory over the Arizona Diamondbacks on Wednesday night . 	 " We are playing much better as a team
column6: who had two hits . " The pitching 's been doing the job
column7: and ( we 're getting ) defense and timely hitting . That 's awesome

column9: then fell behind 1 - 2 and fouled off two consecutive pitches before lining a double past diving first baseman Mark Trumbo . 	 Diamondbacks right fielder Alfredo Marte fumbled the ball as it ricocheted off the wall near Arizona 's bullpen
column10: allowing Pence to score without a throw . Pinch hitter Matt Duffy doubled off Evan Marshall to drive in Blanco . 	 Jean Machi ( 7 - 1 ) retired the only batter he faced for the win
column11: and the Giants remained 2 1/2 games behind the first - place Los Angeles Dodgers in the NL West . 	 " We did a lot of good things
column12: " Bochy said . " Blanco could n't get a bunt down

column21: " Diamondbacks manager Kirk Gibson said . " They keep playing hard
column23: and we did n't respond . " 	 Brandon Crawford scored on a wild pitch and Angel Pagan added a sacrifice fly in the seventh . Travis Ishikawa 's RBI single in the eighth made it 5 - 0 . 	 Both teams missed scoring opportunities early . 	 Arizona left the bases loaded in the second
column24: stranded a runner at third in the fourth and left two on in the seventh . 	 The Giants also struggled with runners in scoring position . San Francisco had men on base in four of the first six innings but came up empty each time . 	 VOGELSONG

column1: LOS ANGELES -- Dan Haren got honest with himself last season with Washington . He was n't throwing in the mid-90 mph range anymore and realized he needed a new identity . 	 He 's found it this season with the Los Angeles Dodgers
column3: Haren is proving to be a reliable fourth starter . 	 He tossed seven sharp innings to give the Dodgers four pitchers with 13 wins for the first time in 29 years in a 4 - 0 victory over the San Diego Padres on Wednesday night . 	 Haren ( 13 - 10 ) allowed four hits
column4: struck out five and walked one . 	 " I swallowed my pride when it comes to velocity a long time ago
column5: " he said . " I just try to get outs . I 've minimized my mistakes and located better . I 've stayed the course . " 	 Haren joined Clayton Kershaw

column12: and if you do n't have late life you 're going to get hit . " 	 Haren and J.P. Howell combined to retire nine consecutive San Diego batters before Kenley Jansen came on in the ninth . 	 " I 've got two or three starts left and if they 're good ones I 'll be in a good place

column20: dropping to 0 - 5 since the start of last season . 	 " He pitched well enough to win

" Maybe he struggled a little bit

column1: CLEVELAND -- Corey Kluber came within two outs of his second straight complete game as the Cleveland Indians defeated the Minnesota Twins 8 - 2 Thursday in the first game of a doubleheader . 	 Kluber ( 15 - 9 ) allowed two runs and struck out seven in 8 1/3 innings in becoming the Indians ' first 15 - game winner since Cliff Lee went 22 - 3 in 2008 . 	 Kluber dominated the Twins after allowing a first - inning run
column2: retiring 18 of 19 before giving up two singles in the eighth . The right - hander worked out of trouble
column3: but was pulled after allowing an RBI single to Trevor Plouffe in the ninth
column4: the third hit of the inning . 	 Yan Gomes drove in three runs with a solo homer in the second and a two - run double in the third . Carlos Santana belted a two - run homer in the first and Cleveland broke the game open with a four - run third . 	 The Indians ( 75 - 69 ) trail first - place Kansas City by five games in the AL Central and are four games behind Detroit in the crowded race for the second wild - card spot . 	 Kyle Gibson ( 11 - 11 ) lasted only three innings
column5: allowing seven runs and seven hits

column1: CINCINNATI --   St. Louis 's drive toward a Central Division championship hit a Cincinnati speed bump . 	 Johnny Cueto pitched eight scoreless innings to beat Lance Lynn and send the Cardinals to their third consecutive loss
column3: Thursday . 	 Cueto ( 18 - 8) allowed just three hits and hit a batter to help the Reds win their second series in the last 13 against Central Division - leading St. Louis . The Cardinals have lost three straight for the first time since a four - game losing streak Aug. 26 - 30 and finished their eight - game road trip 4 - 4 after winning three out of four in Milwaukee . 	 " We 're heading home
column5: who came up short of making the crucial play . " We just have to keep playing . " 	 Aroldis Chapman pitched the ninth for his 33rd save and third in the last three games . 	 " We created an environment where we play the spoiler
column6: " Reds manager Bryan Price said . " There is no secret we 've struggled with the Cardinals the last several years . " 	 Lynn ( 15 - 9 ) retired 15 straight before Brandon Phillips led off the eighth inning with the Reds ' first walk of the game . He went to third on Jay Bruce 's single to center field and scored on Ramon Santiago 's sinking liner to short center that Jay got a glove on but could n't hold . Bruce had to hold up to see if the ball was caught and was forced at second . 	 " I just missed it
column7: " Jay said . " I knew I could n't leave my feet . If I slide
column8: he 's tagging . I tried to be aggressive . " 	 " He 's made great plays all year
column9: " St. Louis manager Mike Matheny said . " That 's one he makes all the time . That one just got away . " 	 The Reds have won three straight games for the first time since August 5 - 7 against Cleveland . They finished their home stand 4 - 3 after losing two out of three against the Mets . 	 Lynn went into the game 3 - 0 with a 4.00 ERA in three starts against the Reds this season . Cueto was 0 - 2 with a 3.75 ERA in two starts against St. Louis . 	 " Today
column11: " Lynn said . " That 's part of it . " 	 Cueto retired the last 14 batters he faced after Matt Adams led off the fourth inning with a single and was eliminated in a double play . Cueto finished with seven strikeouts . 	 Lynn allowed three hits and a walk with six strikeouts in eight innings . 	 Bruce kept the game scoreless with a leaping catch at the right - field fence to rob Adams of a home run leading off the seventh inning . Adams appeared to doff his batting helmet to salute Bruce 's play . 	 ` K ' MAN : Cueto 's seven strikeouts give him 220 this season
column12: the most since Jose Rijo led the National League with 227 in 1993 . 	 HIT MAN : Jay was hit by a pitch for the 19th time this season
column13: the most in the majors . He was plunked for the third consecutive game . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM : Cardinals : Catcher Yadier Molina got Thursday 's game off after playing all of Wednesday 's night game . Molina 's surgically repaired right thumb still is an issue
column14: manager Mike Matheny said . " You can see the splint
column15: " Matheny said . " He 's still protecting it and doing things to strengthen it . " 	 Reds : Catcher Brayan Pena was scratched from the original starting lineup with an illness . Devin Mesoraco started in Pena 's place . 	 UP NEXT : Cardinals : Adam Wainwright starts as St. Louis opens a 10 - day

column1: CHICAGO -- For a guy who says he 's not big into stats
column2: Chris Sale is putting up some really good ones . 	 Sale bested Scott Kazmir in a brilliant pitchers ' duel
column3: light - hitting Marcus Semien homered for the only run and the Chicago White Sox edged the rapidly fading Oakland Athletics 1 - 0 . 	 " I 'm not a numbers guy
column4: I do n't care about any of that stuff
column5: " Sale said . 	 Sale ( 12 - 3 ) gave up two hits in eight innings
column6: both singles by Jed Lowrie . 	 Sale lowered his ERA to an AL - best 1.99
column7: boosting his bid to become the first White Sox pitcher to lead the league in the category since Joe Horlen in 1967 . The ace left - hander struck out nine with two walks and retired 17 batters in a row between Lowrie 's hits . 	 The A 's lost for the 11th time in 14 games . Their lead in the AL wild - card race slipped to one game over Detroit and 1½ games ahead of Seattle . 	 " We 're playing for our lives now
column8: " Oakland manager Bob Melvin said . 	 Sale said he tries to approach each start the same
column9: but acknowledged pitching against a contender provided extra motivation . 	 " Knowing where they 're going and who they are
column10: you obviously try to ( lock in )
column11: " he said . 	 Jake Petricka pitched the ninth
column13: and got his 13th save in 16 tries . 	 Kazmir ( 14 - 8) called the Athletics ' recent stretch " very frustrating " after he went the distance
column15: striking out seven and walking one . 	 Semien hit a leadoff homer in the sixth . He started the day with a .216 batting average and three home runs . 	 " He threw me the first curveball of the game that I 've seen from him
column16: " Semien said . " I put a good swing on it . " 	 Each pitcher had given up only one single to that point . 	 Semien
column17: who batted ninth and played shortstop
column18: also started a double play in the ninth
column19: which featured a nifty barehanded turn by Carlos Sanchez at second to wipe out a leadoff single by Sam Fuld . 	 The Athletics posed their only threat in the eighth . Lowrie 's single and Alberto Callaspo 's two - out walk put a runner in scoring position
column20: but Coco Crisp bounced out to end the inning . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Athletics : LHP Sean Doolittle is expected to return from the disabled list Friday . The closer has been sidelined since Aug. 24 because of a strained intercostal muscle . ... OF Craig Gentry was held out of the series finale one day after he suffered a concussion on a play at first base . He 's likely to sit out the series in Seattle this weekend . ... C Stephen Vogt wo n't be available until next week at the earliest with a left ankle sprain . 	 White Sox : 1B Paul Konerko will test his fractured left hand with some dry swings on Friday then plans to hit short tosses and off a tee Saturday . The veteran could return to action on the next road trip . " I 'm going to be back
column22: who will retire after the season . " There 's no doubt . " 	 UP NEXT 	 Athletics : RHP Jason Hammel ( 2 - 5

column1: CLEVELAND --   A long day at the ballpark was well worth it for the Cleveland Indians . 	 " Doubleheaders are hard to win
column2: " manager Terry Francona said after Cleveland swept Minnesota on Thursday . " It worked out pretty well for us . That 's exactly what we hoped for . " 	 Another strong performance by Corey Kluber and a two - run homer by Carlos Santana sparked an 8 - 2 victory in the first game . 	 Santana homered again and drove in both runs while rookie T.J. House and the bullpen combined on a four - hitter in a 2 - 0 win in game two . 	 Cleveland moved closer in the races for both the AL Central title and the wild card . The Indians trail Detroit by 3 1 - 2 games for the second wild - card spot
column3: and visit the Tigers for a three - game series starting Friday night . 	 " Right now we 've got to try to win every night
column4: " Kluber said . " We ca n't worry about the other teams because that takes away from our focus . Until we 're eliminated we 've got a chance . " 	 Cleveland 's pitchers ruled the day
column6: striking out 17 and allowing one walk
column7: which came in the ninth inning of game two . As has been the case all season
column8: Kluber ( 15 - 9 ) set the tone . The right - hander allowed two runs and struck out seven in 8 1/3 innings in becoming the Indians ' first 15 - game winner since Cliff Lee went 22 - 3 in 2008 . 	 For one of the few times this season
column9: the offense gave Kluber some cushion . Yan Gomes homered and drove in three runs
column10: Michael Brantley had two RBIs and Cleveland put the game away with a four - run third inning . 	 " Corey was outstanding
column11: " Francona said . " Once he got the lead he pounded the zone . It seems like he 's always in a one - run game . With all the innings he 's pitched
column12: it seems like every inning he pitches there is no margin of error . " 	 Kyle Gibson ( 11 - 11 ) lasted only three innings
column13: allowing seven runs and seven hits
column14: including two homers 	 House ( 3 - 3 ) pitched seven sharp innings in game two . The left - hander held Minnesota to four hits
column15: struck out eight and did n't walk a batter . 	 Bryan Shaw pitched the eighth and Cody Allen worked the ninth for his 20th save . Allen walked pinch - hitter Joe Mauer
column16: the Twins ' only free pass of the day
column17: but Trevor Plouffe flied out and Kennys Vargas bounced into a double play . 	 Santana has 27 home runs
column18: matching his career high . His leadoff homer on a 1 - 2 pitch in the fourth was the only mistake Ricky Nolasco ( 5 - 11 ) made in seven innings . 	 Santana added an RBI single in the eighth . 	 Kluber did n't walk a batter for the second straight outing . He broke his three - game losing streak with a five - hitter in a complete game win over the White Sox on Saturday . 	 Vargas ' two - out RBI single put Minnesota ahead in the first . Kluber retired the next 10 hitters
column19: a stretch that was broken when Oswaldo Arcia led off the fifth with a single . 	 Kluber regained control by getting Kurt Suzuki to bounce into a double play that began a stretch when he retired eight in a row . 	 After winning game one of the series Tuesday
column20: the doubleheader was a lost day for the Twins . 	 " We could n't get anything going
column21: " manager Ron Gardenhire . 	 CALL HIM ACE 	 Kluber 's 15 wins put him one victory behind Max Scherzer and Jered Weaver for the AL lead . " He 's been so amazingly consistent
column22: and at a high level -- and he 's only going to get better
column23: " Francona said . 	 LET IT POUR 	 Wednesday 's rainout was the fifth for the Indians this season
column24: including four at Progressive Field . Cleveland has played three home doubleheaders with Thursday 's ending an 11 - game homestand
column25: the longest of the season . The Indians played a makeup game of a June 18 rainout against the Angels on Monday . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Twins : Danny Santana
column26: who missed two games with a strained back
column27: started the first game in center field . The rookie strained his back making a throw from the outfield Saturday . 	 Indians : INF / OF Mike Aviles ( concussion ) passed the protocol tests and appeared in both games . He entered the opener in the eighth as a pinch - hitter and started the second game at third base . Aviles was injured attempting to make a diving catch in right field on Sept. 1 . column1: SAN FRANCISCO --   Jake Peavy brings an all - out intensity to the San Francisco Giants that manager Bruce Bochy considers perfect for the September push . The veteran pitcher only wishes he could face the Los Angeles Dodgers this weekend . 	 Peavy did his part to put San Francisco in prime position heading into the key series
column2: striking out eight without walking a batter to win his third start in a row in the Giants ' 6 - 2 victory against the Arizona Diamondbacks on Thursday . 	 San Francisco
column3: which leads the NL wild - card standings
column4: pulled within two games of the idle Dodgers a day before a key weekend series against the NL West leaders at AT&T Park . 	 " There 's nobody in this clubhouse who believes we ca n't get it done . There 's a championship pedigree around here
column5: " Peavy said . " Over the past few weeks
column6: we 've found some identity . " 	 Hunter Pence put the Giants ahead on a quirky RBI single in the first . Pence literally threw his bat at the ball
column7: which hit the front corner of second base and skipped into shallow right - center . Pence also drew a bases - loaded walk in his team 's season - best ninth straight home win . 	 " Everybody was kind of laughing
column9: who came off the bench to add an RBI double . " You do n't see that every time . " 	 Buster Posey had a more traditional RBI single among his three hits
column10: helping the Giants extend their season - best home winning streak . It 's their longest unbeaten run at AT&T Park since nine in a row in May 2011 . 	 Peavy ( 5 - 4 ) walked off to a standing ovation in the sixth after allowing Mark Trumbo 's RBI double . The right - hander is 5 - 1 with a 1.12 ERA over his last six starts
column11: finally getting ample run support . Peavy allowed six hits in all over 5 2/3 innings
column12: and has been an important addition since his trade from the Red Sox on July 26 . 	 Jake Lamb homered against Santiago Casilla in the ninth
column13: but Arizona matched its season - high losing streak at six games . 	 " If you 're not hitting
column15: and we did n't do that
column16: " center fielder A.J. Pollock said . " They had a couple of hits I 'm still scratching my head how they got . But they are believing in it right now and have a lot of positive vibes going . " 	 After Pence 's earlier bloop
column17: Brandon Crawford hit a single that barely fell in down the line . Left fielder Alfredo Marte tried to catch the ball
column18: stumbled over the bullpen mound and lost his glove . Crawford advanced on the error . 	 The Giants swept Arizona at home for the first time since May 2011 . San Francisco plays all of its remaining games against division opponents . 	 Randall Delgado ( 3 - 4 ) was tagged for three runs and seven hits in four innings
column19: making just his second start since April 10 . He spent most of the season as a reliever . 	 Arizona 's starting pitchers have allowed three or fewer runs in 14 straight games . 	 The Giants have outscored opponents 58 - 14 during their home winning streak . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Diamondbacks : The D - backs were hopeful rookie OF David Peralta could return Friday from a back injury but manager Kirk Gibson indicated it could be a few more days . Peralta
column20: who has n't played since Sept. 5
column21: is scheduled for an MRI exam Friday . 	 Giants : OF-1B Michael Morse took dry swings as he works back from a left oblique strain that has forced him to miss the last nine games . " He 's about 50 percent right now
column24: two to three days away . " 	 THE OTHER BOCHY 	 Bochy 's pitching son
column25: Brett
column26: is yet to make his major league debut since joining the club as a September call - up . A few more runs on the board and he might have had his chance . 	 " I have guys who need some work
column27: " the manager said . " I 'll get him in at some point . He gets it . He 's been around the game a long time . " 	 UP NEXT 	 Diamondbacks : LHP Vidal Nuno ( 0 - 5
column28: 3.16 ) tries again for his first victory since joining Arizona from the New York Yankees
column29: when the D - backs open a six - game homestand by hosting the San Diego Padres . Nuno 's last win came June 27 against the Red Sox . He has allowed two runs or fewer in his last five starts . 	 Giants : LHP Madison Bumgarner ( 17 - 9
column30: 3.02 ) pitches the opener against the Dodgers
column31: looking to build on his already career - best wins . One strikeout will give Bumgarner 200 in a season for the first time in his career . 	 SELIG VISIT : Commissioner Bud Selig stopped at AT&T Park and toured the new edible garden in center field as part of his farewell ballpark tour . He said he is 18 ballparks into his schedule
column32: with four or five more upcoming stops on the calendar and more in the playoffs . 	 From MVP to Cy Young and more

column1: NEW YORK -- The first momentous thing Chris Young did Thursday night was spoil Alex Cobb 's bid for a no - hitter
column2: saving the Yankees some embarrassment . 	 Then
column3: he gave them a scintillating victory . 	 Young doubled in the eighth inning for New York 's first hit and launched a three - run homer in the bottom of the ninth that rallied the Yankees to a 5 - 4 victory over the stunned Tampa Bay Rays . 	 " It feels like you 're floating on a cloud . I do n't even remember it
column6: swarmed by happy teammates and doused with orange sports drink during his postgame television interview . " All I remember is hitting the ball and being at home plate . " 	 Pinch hitter Martin Prado connected for a two - run shot immediately after Cobb was pulled in the eighth
column7: and the Yankees took two of three in the series by climbing out of a four - run hole for the second consecutive night -- the only times they 've done that all season . 	 Young homered off closer Jake McGee with one out to win it . Clinging to slim playoff hopes
column8: the Yankees finished 5 - 4 on their penultimate homestand to move within four games of Detroit for the second American League wild card with 18 remaining . Three other teams are between them and the Tigers . 	 Yunel Escobar homered twice and drove in four runs for Tampa Bay . 	 Young 's one - out double ended Cobb 's attempt to become the first visiting pitcher to throw a no - hitter at Yankee Stadium since Virgil Trucks did it for the Detroit Tigers in 1952 . Six pitchers combined on a no - hitter for the Houston Astros in the Bronx on June 11
column9: 2003 . 	 " Wow . I do n't think it 's actually set in yet
column10: " Cobb said . 	 He was lifted after Young 's opposite - field drive up the right - center alley on his 102nd pitch . The right - hander with the funky windup
column12: received a warm hand from a crowd of 32
column13: 627 that included former Yankees great Mariano Rivera . 	 " It was tough to break it up at that point
column15: who was a little surprised to be taken out . " At that point
column16: I was still in game mode . I looked up at the video board and saw that it was a pretty decent pitch
column17: so I was n't too upset about it . " 	 Prado
column18: on the bench because of a sore hamstring
column19: homered off Brad Boxberger to trim Tampa Bay 's lead to 4 - 2 . 	 Moments later
column20: Derek Jeter was hit by a pitch on the left elbow and bent over in obvious pain . Jeter stayed in the game
column21: and X - rays were negative . He said he was fine . 	 New York got a bigger scare in the ninth when Chase Headley was struck on the chin by a 98 mph fastball from McGee ( 4 - 2 ) . Headley stayed down on his back for a couple of minutes as he was attended to by two trainers . 	 With blood trickling down his chin
column22: Headley sat up and walked off the field with both trainers . He was taken to a hospital for further evaluation . 	 " It does n't appear he will need stitches . His teeth are all there . I still think you have to get his jaw X - rayed
column24: adding that Headley would not travel with the team to Baltimore but could join the Yankees there at some point Friday . 	 Ichiro Suzuki followed with a double
column25: and Young
column26: released last month by the crosstown Mets after a season - long slump
column27: drove an 0 - 1 pitch to left field for his latest big hit in pinstripes this week . 	 He has made three starts for the Yankees
column28: all as an injury fill - in during the Tampa Bay series
column29: and finished a triple shy of the cycle Wednesday night . 	 " He 's done an awful lot . They said he was a talented player who had a rough year this year
column30: " Girardi said . " It 's amazing how things can turn around for a player . ... That 's a huge hit for us . " 	 Shawn Kelley ( 3 - 5 ) got two outs for the win . 	 Cobb has n't yielded more than two runs in any of his past 12 starts

column33: for the first multihomer game of his career . 	 BIG FLY 	 It was Young 's sixth career game - ending homer and New York 's fourth of the season . His previous one came Aug. 11

RAY MATTER 	 The Yankees said Cobb 's gem was the deepest a Tampa Bay pitcher has gone without allowing a hit since Matt Garza pitched the team 's only no - hitter against Detroit on July 26

column2: and the Pittsburgh Pirates beat the Phillies 4 - 1 on Thursday night . He allowed only six baserunners . column3: and the Pirates scored three times in the sixth inning . 	 Liriano ( 5 - 10 ) got rare run support from his teammates

column1: NEW YORK --   If only the Washington Nationals could play all their road games at Citi Field . 	 Adam LaRoche and Anthony Rendon had two - run homers off Bartolo Colon
column2: who was ejected after hitting the following batter both times

column13: you 're just kind of in rhythm with them . " 	 Washington opened its NL East lead to 8 1/2 games over second - place Atlanta

column2: Texas -- When Garrett Richards went on the disabled list last month
column3: the big question was who would replace him in the Los Angeles Angels ' rotation . 	 The answer : almost everybody . 	 Eight Angels pitchers combined for a 7 - 3 victory over the Texas Rangers on Thursday night
column4: giving Los Angeles its eighth straight win . 	 The Angels lost three of their first five games after a torn left patellar tendon sidelined Richards -- a 13 - game winner -- on Aug. 21 . 	 But Los Angeles has won 14 of 16 and moved 10 games ahead of second - place Oakland in the American League West with 16 games to play . 	 Using relief pitchers
column5: the Angels have won all three starts Richards would have made . 	 " They keep getting it done
column6: " Los Angeles manager Mike Scioscia said . " When you have a bullpen game
column7: you see which way the game branches out . ( On Thursday )
column8: it took eight pitchers to get it done . " 	 After starting the season with 24 relief appearances
column9: right - hander Cory Rasmus has started all three bullpen games . Against the Rangers
column11: he allowed only a leadoff home run and a single to Leonys Martin . 	 " I felt it was another step forward
column12: " Rasmus said . " If you give up a home run to the first hitter of the game
column14: bear down and make some better pitches . 	 " Everybody feels pretty excited about our bullpen . You throw your inning or two innings and put up a zero
column15: everybody does the same . " 	 What does it mean that the Angels have won all three of his starts ? 	 " It means we put up a lot of runs
column16: " he said . 	 Texas actually slowed down the Angels
column17: who averaged nine runs over the first seven games of the winning streak . 	 Erick Aybar homered against Nick Martinez ( 3 - 11 ) in the second inning to put the Angels ahead 2 - 1 . The shortstop entered the game batting .383 ( 36 - for-94 ) since Aug. 16
column18: best in the AL during that span . 	 David Freese had a two - run single in the third
column19: and Kole Calhoun 's RBI single in the seventh made it 5 - 1 . Pinch hitter Grant Green added a two - run single in the eighth . 	 Mike Morin ( 4 - 3 )
column21: got the win . He entered the game to retire Elvis Andrus with the bases loaded in the fourth and worked a scoreless fifth inning . 	 J.P. Arencibia also had a solo homer for the Rangers . 	 The Rangers have lost five of six under interim manager Tim Bogar
column22: and 11 of their past 12 overall to fall 37 games behind Los Angeles in the division . During that stretch
column23: Texas has totaled only 24 runs . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Angels : LF Josh Hamilton ( shoulder ) missed his seventh game in a row but said he was feeling better . " He 's not really going to test it for a couple of days
column24: " Scioscia said . ... RHP Huston Street ( right hamstring ) has n't pitched since Saturday . 	 Rangers : C Robinson Chirinos ( stiff neck ) missed his 10th straight game
column25: but he warmed up Texas ' pitcher before one inning . Bogar said he expected Chirinos to play Friday . 	 UP NEXT 	 Each team opens a three - game series at home Friday night . 	 Los Angeles LHP C.J. Wilson ( 11 - 9

column2: Mo. -- The Boston Red Sox did a better job of walking a tightrope than the Kansas City Royals . 	 At least
column3: that 's how manager John Farrell summed up Thursday night 's 6 - 3 victory . 	 The last - place Red Sox took advantage of three critical errors by the first - place Royals
column4: and managed to deal with their own costly miscue to end a frustrating four - game losing streak . 	 " Both sides were capitalizing on errant throws or hit - by - pitches
column5: " Farrell said . " Any time you give a club an extra out
column7: and that was the case tonight . " 	 Clay Buchholz ( 8 - 8) allowed three runs
column9: over 6 1/3 innings for the Red Sox . He turned a one - run lead over to the Boston bullpen
column10: and it preserved his sixth straight win against the Royals . Edward Mujica handled a perfect ninth for his fifth save . 	 Kansas City 's advantage in the AL Central dropped to a half - game over idle Detroit . 	 " I felt good with my off - speed stuff early
column12: who is starting to resemble the All - Star of last year . " With the lefties they have in their lineup
column13: it 's a pitch I needed to have any chance of winning tonight . " 	 Liam Hendriks ( 1 - 2 ) failed to last three innings while making a spot start for left - hander Danny Duffy
column14: who is shelved with shoulder soreness . The Royals ' defense did n't do Hendriks any favors
column16: making all three errors in the first four frames . 	 " There are no focus issues there
column17: " Royals manager Ned Yost said later . 	 " That 's baseball
column18: " Royals shortstop Alcides Escobar added . " That happens . " 	 Nearly every run scored in the game was a product of some sort of mishap
column19: though . 	 In the second inning
column20: Boston 's Will Middlebrooks doubled and then scored when Eric Hosmer allowed a two - out grounder by Christian Vazquez to get by him into right field . It was the Gold Glove first baseman 's third error in four games and his 10th of the season . 	 The Royals pulled ahead in the bottom half
column21: getting a two - out double from Lorenzo Cain and back - to - back singles by Escobar and Nori Aoki . On Aoki 's hit
column23: and first baseman Mike Napoli tried to throw him out . The cross - diamond throw nearly wound up in the visiting dugout
column24: and the error allowed Escobar to trot home for a 2 - 1 lead . 	 Boston pulled back ahead in the third . Mookie Betts singled
column25: Xander Bogaerts walked
column26: and Yoenis Cespedes was hit by a pitch to load the bases . Hendriks walked Napoli to tie the game
column27: and Middlebrooks singled up the middle to give the Red Sox the lead . 	 They added another run in the fourth
column28: thanks in part to two more errors . 	 Kansas City pieced together a promising rally in the sixth . Josh Willingham was hit by a pitch leading off
column29: and Mike Moustakas and Cain hit back - to - back two - out singles to make it 4 - 3 . But Buchholz bounced back to strike out Escobar and preserve the lead . 	 Jemile Weeks added a two - run double in the eighth to give Boston a cushion . 	 " We 're struggling offensively a little bit
column30: " Yost said . " Plus
column31: Hendriks went out
column32: had a really good first inning . The error in the second inning cost him a run . He lost all his tempo in the third inning . He was really rushing his delivery to the plate . " 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Red Sox : 2B Dustin Pedroia had surgery Thursday to repair tendon damage and clean out scar tissue in his troublesome left wrist . He is expected to heal in about six weeks . " It created more range of motion and instant relief than Dustin has felt
column33: " Farrell said . 	 Royals : RHP Greg Holland ( muscle stiffness ) felt good after throwing Monday
column35: and could have been available . ... Duffy said he hopes to begin throwing in the next couple of days . He is due to start Tuesday against the White Sox . 	 UP NEXT 	 Red Sox : RHP Allen Webster ( 3 - 3
