column1: MILWAUKEE --   The Miami Marlins lost much more than a game . They 've likely lost All - Star slugger Giancarlo Stanton for the rest of the season after a frightening scene at Miller Park . 	 Stanton sustained multiple facial fractures
column2: dental damage and cuts that needed stitches after being hit in the face by a fastball from Milwaukee 's Mike Fiers . 	 The Marlins said Stanton
column3: the major league RBI leader and a top candidate for the NL MVP award
column4: would return to Miami on Friday . 	 " We do not believe he will require surgery
column5: " the team said Friday . 	 Asked if Stanton could play again this season
column7: " It does not look good . " 	 " It 's devastating for us . Devastating . For his season to end like that
column10: " Redmond said . 	 Stanton 's father was at Thursday night 's game and came onto the field while his son was treated . Stanton was bleeding heavily from his mouth
column11: and was driven away from the plate in an ambulance . His father rode with him to the hospital . 	 Redmond said Stanton did not lose consciousness . Stanton did not say anything while down on the ground
column14: " Redmond said . " We 're hoping he is going to be all right . " 	 The outfielder tops the NL with 37 home runs and has 105 RBIs
column15: and is batting .288 . Miami has 17 games left this year . 	 It was ruled that Stanton swung trying to get out of the way of the 88 mph pitch from Fiers . Reed Johnson batted for Stanton and was hit in the hand by Fiers ' next pitch
column16: bringing angry players off the Marlins bench . Miami 's Casey McGehee and Redmond were ejected . 	 It was also ruled that Johnson swung at the pitch that hit him
column17: ending the inning with two runners on base . 	 " I 've never seen anything like that and I 've definitely never seen two swings called on those two plays
column18: " Redmond said . " I 've never seen a guy get hit in the mouth and called for a swing . He 's out there bleeding at home plate and for the first base ump to say he swung at that pitch
column19: what a joke . " 	 Plate umpire Jeff Kellogg said he consulted with first base umpire D.J. Reyburn and determined that both Stanton and Johnson had swung . 	 " We 've both looked at it and
column21: he did swing . They both did
column23: " Kellogg said . 	 Redmond and Johnson said the benches cleared because of the reaction by Fiers after Johnson get hit . Fiers threw up his hands and looked into the Marlins ' dugout . 	 " He just knocked out our best player
column24: hit him in the mouth and then you just hit another guy in the hand
column25: " Redmond said . " What are we supposed to do ? No doubt
column26: we 're trying to win games
column27: they 're trying to win games
column28: but you just hit a guy in the mouth . " 	 Fiers insisted the pitch got away from him . He apologized to Stanton on Twitter after the game and was distraught on the field and in the locker room . 	 " It was heat of the moment stuff
column29: " Fiers said . " I just want to make sure that Stanton is OK . I just want to send my thoughts and prayers and everything to Stanton . You never think of throwing at somebody like that . Never in my life has that happened . I just feel very
column30: very sad that I hit him . I 'm sorry to their teammates
column31: their fans
column32: his family . It is just tough . " 	 Miami reliever Anthony Desclafani hit Carlos Gomez in the sixth with a pitch and was quickly ejected by Kellogg . Marlins bench coach Rob Leary was also tossed . 	 Ryan Braun and rookie Matt Clark hit home runs for Milwaukee . The Brewers are 1 1/2 games behind Pittsburgh for the second NL wild - card spot . 	 Fiers ( 6 - 2 ) pitched five innings . He is 6 - 1 since being recalled from the minors to join the rotation Aug. 9 . Francisco Rodriguez pitched a scoreless ninth to record his 41st save in 46 chances . 	 Nathan Eovaldi ( 6 - 11 ) lasted only four innings
column33: giving up four runs and eight hits . 	 HOME RUN STREAK 	 Marcell Ozuna hit his 23rd homer in the eighth
column34: a two - run shot . Ozuna homered in his fourth straight game
column35: tying a team record . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Marlins : RHP All - Star Henderson Alvarez is set to return to the mound Friday as he missed his last start after straining his oblique Sept. 1 . 	 Brewers : Braun was back in the starting lineup after not starting the past two games as he nurses a thumb injury . 	 UP NEXT 	 Marlins : Miami moves on to Philadelphia

column2: the Baltimore Orioles loaded the bases against the New York Yankees for the third time in four innings . 	 After being denied twice earlier
column3: the Orioles finally took advantage of the situation . 	 Jimmy Paredes hit a two - run double with two outs in the 11th inning to rally Baltimore to a 2 - 1 victory Friday in the opener of a day - night doubleheader . 	 After Chris Young homered in the top of the 11th
column4: Baltimore countered in the bottom half against Adam Warren ( 3 - 6 ) . 	 Two walks sandwiched around a hit batter loaded the bases for Paredes
column5: who pinch hit for Jonathan Schoop . He drove the first pitch into the right - field corner to provide the AL East - leading Orioles with their fifth straight win
column6: tying their season high . 	 " For me
column7: I do n't feel any pressure in the moment
column9: acquired from Kansas City on July 24 . " I go to home plate to try to do my job . " 	 Adam Jones struck out with the bases loaded in the eighth
column10: and Schoop fanned in the same situation in the ninth . 	 The victory served as a bit of good news on a day in which slugger Chris Davis began a 25 - game suspension without pay for a positive test for an amphetamine . The suspension will cover the final 17 games of the regular season and run into the playoffs should the Orioles advance for the second time in three years . 	 " Dwelling on this is n't going to do us any good
column11: " right fielder Nick Markakis said . " Today was a big win for us
column12: and that 's our standpoint . " 	 Brad Brach ( 7 - 1 ) got the win despite giving up Young 's second home run in two games . Young hit a winning
column13: three - run drive against Tampa Bay in the ninth inning on Thursday night . 	 This game was a makeup of the rainout on Aug. 12 . 	 Baltimore began the day with a 10 - game division lead
column14: its largest since 1979 . The Yankees started four games back for the second AL wild card and are in danger of missing consecutive postseasons for the first time since 1992 and ' 93 . 	 " To see us get that home run and us get the lead
column15: then give it back like that
column16: it 's extremely frustrating for me
column17: " Warren said . 	 Manager Joe Girardi echoed the sentiment . 	 " You get the home run and a chance to catch some momentum after the way we won last night
column18: it 's frustrating
column19: " he said . 	 Brandon McCarthy blanked Baltimore on four hits over seven - plus innings in a duel with rookie Kevin Gausman
column20: who allowed seven hits over seven innings . 	 " That kind of game you would love to win
column21: where you grind and you grind and you pull it out in the end and gain some momentum
column22: " McCarthy said . 	 New York played without shortstop Derek Jeter
column23: who was struck on the left elbow with a pitch on Thursday night . 	 The crowd was kept entertained by a series of fly - overs by the Blue Angels
column24: who repeatedly circled the stadium while practicing for a ceremony at nearby Fort McHenry to mark the 200th anniversary of " The Star - Spangled Banner . " 	 At one point
column25: McCarthy paused briefly on the mound to check out the action . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Yankees : 3B Chase Headley did not play after being hit in the jaw by a pitch against the Rays . He was to be examined by a neurologist Friday . Also
column26: Yankees RHP David Phelps ( elbow inflammation ) was activated from the 15 - day disabled list . 	 Orioles : SS J.J. Hardy returned missing time with back spasms . 	 UP NEXT 	 Brandon Mitchell was to make his first major league start for the Yankees in the second game of the doubleheader

column1: PHILADELPHIA --   Cody Asche certainly savored his game - ending swing Friday night . 	 Asche hit a two - run homer in the 10th inning to give the Philadelphia Phillies a 3 - 1 victory over the Miami Marlins . 	 " I 've been waiting my whole life to do something like that
column2: " Asche said . " It 's a cool feeling . " 	 Cole Hamels scattered nine hits over seven stingy innings and Philadelphia handed the Marlins their third straight defeat in their first game since Giancarlo Stanton was injured . 	 Stanton
column4: was struck in the face Thursday night by an 88 mph fastball from Milwaukee right - hander Mike Fiers . Stanton sustained multiple facial fractures and severe lacerations as well as dental damage . 	 But the two - time All - Star got good news Friday
column5: when the Marlins announced he probably wo n't need major surgery . Stanton received dental treatment in Miami and the club has n't ruled out a return this season
column6: although that hinges on his medical condition . 	 " It 's a huge loss
column7: " Miami manager Mike Redmond said . " Not only is he a huge part of the team
column8: but it changes the whole lineup . It is what it is . That 's the situation we 're in . We 're a resilient team . " 	 Ed Lucas played right field in place of Stanton
column9: who began the day leading the National League in home runs ( 37 ) and RBIs ( 105 ) . Lucas had two hits but committed a costly error . 	 Jake Diekman ( 5 - 4 ) pitched a scoreless 10th to cap three hitless innings by Philadelphia relievers . Jonathan Papelbon retired the side in the ninth after Ken Giles did so in the eighth . 	 Asche went deep off Dan Jennings ( 0 - 2 ) with one out . Chris Hatcher retired the first batter in the inning before Jennings relieved . Ben Revere singled to center and then Asche drove a 2 - 2 slider deep into the seats in right . 	 " One bad pitch
column10: " Jennings said . " I thought I was throwing well until the last pitch . " 	 Philadelphia improved to 10 - 10 in extra - inning games this season . 	 " It was an exciting finish
column11: " Phillies manager Ryne Sandberg said . " It goes a long way with the guys in the clubhouse . " 	 Adeiny Hechavarria had two hits and an RBI for Miami . Henderson Alvarez returned to the rotation after missing his previous turn due to a strained left oblique . He allowed one run and seven hits with four strikeouts and no walks in seven innings . 	 Hamels struck out six and walked one . The left - hander has yielded three earned runs or fewer in 20 straight starts . 	 Hechavarria 's two - out single in the sixth
column12: the third of three singles in the inning
column13: gave Miami a 1 - 0 lead . 	 The Marlins helped the Phillies tie it in the sixth . Chase Utley doubled and reached third on Lucas ' error in right . After Ryan Howard struck out
column14: Utley scored on Henderson Alvarez 's wild pitch . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Marlins : Stanton sent a thank you to fans and supporters on Twitter
column15: saying : " The amount of support I have received from you guys has been tremendous & Heartfelt . I 'm much better today & deeply appreciate your prayers ! " 	 Phillies : SS Jimmy Rollins missed his fourth straight game since straining his left hamstring on Monday . 	 UP NEXT 	 Marlins : LHP Brad Hand ( 3 - 6
column16: 4.45 ERA ) looks to continue his September rebound Saturday night against the Phillies . After going 0 - 3 with a 6.17 ERA in August
column17: Hand is 1 - 0 with a 2.00 ERA in two appearances this month . He pitched six sharp innings in Sunday 's 4 - 0 win over Atlanta . 	 Phillies : RHP Kyle Kendrick ( 8 - 12
column18: 4.83 ) continues his September audition for free agency . He is 0 - 1 with a 4.82 ERA in three starts against Miami this season . 	 LIGHTS OUT 	 Giles has retired 23 straight batters
column19: 12 on strikeouts . The hard - throwing rookie has a 1.11 ERA . 	 BACK IN FORM 	 Alvarez lasted just 2 1/3 innings in his previous start on Sept. 1 . After missing one turn due to the injury
column20: he looked much more like the pitcher who made the All - Star team this season . 	 " I thought he looked good
column21: " Redmond said . " He gave us a great effort . Too bad we could n't capitalize on it . " 	 Detroit got a jump - start on the winter signings
column22: landing lefty Eduardo Rodriguez . We break down the deal . 	 In a free - agent field filled with future Hall of Famers

Check out some of the most electric moments from Vladimir Guerrero Jr. 's career . column1: PITTSBURGH --   Gerrit Cole has picked the right time to start winning -- in the midst of a pennant race . 	 Cole won consecutive starts for the first time since early June
column2: National League batting leader Josh Harrison had three hits
column3: and the surging Pittsburgh Pirates beat the Chicago Cubs 7 - 3 Friday night for their seventh win in eight games . 	 Cole ( 9 - 5 ) improved to 5 - 0 against the Cubs
column5: five hits and one walk in six innings with six strikeouts . He also won at Wrigley Field last weekend . 	 Cole 's only other consecutive winning starts this year were April 4 and 10
column6: and May 29 and June 3 . He also spent two stints on the disabled list
column7: totaling 70 days . 	 Though he was n't at his best
column8: Cole was able to escape a bases - loaded jam in the sixth inning after Welington Castillo 's RBI single had pulled the Cubs to 4 - 3 . Cole got Arismendy Alcantara to foul out to the catcher to end the inning . 	 " He has been able to slow himself down and focus on making the next big pitch
column9: " Pirates manager Clint Hurdle said of Cole . " He did a good job of the big pitch when he had to . " 	 Pittsburgh is 14 - 7 since Aug. 20
column10: moving a season - high nine games over .500 at 78 - 69 . The Pirates
column11: who were eight games under as late as May 21 ( 18 - 26 )
column12: maintained a 1 1/2 - game lead over Milwaukee for the second NL wild card . 	 " We 're playing really good baseball right now
column13: " shortstop Jordy Mercer said . " Even though we 've been scoring runs
column14: it always comes down to pitching and defense and that was the difference . " 	 Harrison raised his average to .318 while scoring a pair of runs from the leadoff spot . Mercer also had three hits and drove in three runs
column15: including a two - run single in the sixth that made it 6 - 3 . 	 Neil Walker had a pair of RBI singles for the Pirates
column16: who had 14 hits . 	 Alcantara and fellow rookie Javier Baez homered for the Cubs
column17: who have lost seven straight in their longest skid since 2012 . Baez had hit .103 in his previous 10 games and Alcantara batted .130 in his past 14 . 	 Tsuyoshi Wada ( 4 - 3 ) gave up four runs and nine hits in 4 1/3 innings . 	 " I thought we put in some pretty good at bats
column18: " Cubs manager Rick Renteria said . " I thought
column19: overall
column20: we played a little bit better than we had the previous six games . " 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Cubs : 1B Anthony Rizzo ( lower back strain ) took batting practice and ran the bases during a pregame workout but missed his 16th straight game and likely wo n't return until Monday
column21: when Chicago hosts Cincinnati . 	 Pirates : LF Starling Marte ( bruised left elbow ) sat out after leaving Thursday night 's win at Philadelphia when he was hit by a pitch . RHP Charlie Morton ( right hip inflammation / sports hernia ) threw 42 pitches in a bullpen session and hopes to pitch in relief . His last major league appearance was on Aug. 15 when he started and lost at Washington . 	 UP NEXT 	 Cubs LHP Felix Doubront ( 3 - 5

column1: BALTIMORE -- The Baltimore Orioles lose players and keep winning . 	 Bud Norris pitched seven innings of three - hit ball
column2: and the Orioles beat the Yankees 5 - 0 Friday night to become the first team since 2006 to sweep a doubleheader from New York . 	 In the first game of the day - night twinbill
column3: Jimmy Paredes hit a two - run double with two outs in the 11th inning for a 2 - 1 victory . 	 Baltimore slugger Chris Davis began a 25 - game suspension without pay for a positive test for an amphetamine . The suspension will cover the final 17 games of the regular season and run into the playoffs
column4: or perhaps into 2015 . 	 The Orioles had already lost catcher Matt Wieters ( elbow surgery ) and third baseman Manny Machado ( knee ) for the year . 	 Undeterred
column5: Baltimore extended its winning streak to a season - high six games
column6: moved a season - best 29 games over .500 ( 88 - 59 ) and increased its lead over second - place Toronto in the AL East to 11½ games . The Orioles lowered their magic number for clinching the division to five . 	 " It 's just another bump in the road that you 've got to overcome
column7: " outfielder Nick Markakis said . " It 's a long season and we know what we have to do . " 	 Starters J.J. Hardy
column9: Markakis sat out the second game
column10: and the Orioles still pulled off the sweep . 	 " I think we played every position player here in both games and ... I was n't going to pitch anybody twice in the doubleheader
column11: " manager Buck Showalter said . " Fortunately I did that but only because we 've got some skilled people that can do a job . " 	 It was a wasted day for the Yankees
column12: who scored just one run in 20 innings . New York dropped five games back for the second AL wild card and is in danger of missing the postseason in consecutive years for the first time since 1992 - 93 . 	 " No excuses
column13: " first baseman Brian McCann said . " We have to be able to score runs . " 	 Since the start of the 2000 season
column15: including this one . The only other time they dropped both games was on Sept. 17
column17: against Boston . 	 Norris ( 13 - 8) struck out 10 and walked two in improving to 3 - 0 against the Yankees this season . He outpitched Bryan Mitchell ( 0 - 1 )
column18: who allowed two runs and six hits over five innings in his first big league start . 	 Baltimore took a 2 - 0 lead in the fourth inning when Ryan Flaherty doubled in a run and scored on a triple by Alejandro De Aza . In the seventh
column19: Delmon Young hit a two - run single off David Phelps following three straight walks . 	 That was enough to saddle the punchless Yankees with their 10th loss in 13 games against the Orioles this season . 	 " I thought we had a chance to win this afternoon when we scored the one run
column20: but tonight we did n't do anything against Norris
column21: " manager Joe Girardi said . " He 's pitched well against us before but tonight we did n't do anything . You have to score runs . We 're pretty beat up right now
column22: but you have to keep fighting . It 's that time of the season . " 	 In the opener
column23: after Chris Young homered off Brad Brach ( 7 - 1 ) in the top of the 11th
column24: Baltimore countered in the bottom half against Adam Warren ( 3 - 6 ) . 	 Two walks sandwiched around a hit batter loaded the bases for Paredes
column25: pinch hitting for Jonathan Schoop . He drove the first pitch into the right - field corner . 	 Brandon McCarthy blanked Baltimore on four hits over seven - plus innings in a duel with rookie Kevin Gausman
column26: who allowed seven hits over seven innings . 	 The opener was a makeup of the rainout on Aug. 12 . column1: TORONTO --   With some solid pitch calling
column3: Rays catcher Ryan Hanigan earned himself a dinner date with pitcher Nathan Karns . 	 Karns got his first major league win in his Tampa Bay debut
column4: Hanigan homered for the first time in almost three months and the Rays beat the Blue Jays 1 - 0 Friday night to stop Toronto 's four - game winning streak . 	 " I really relied on ( Hanigan ) today
column5: " Karns said . " He did a great job behind the dish and got the only run of the game . I think I owe him a steak dinner . " 	 Karns ( 1 - 0 ) allowed two hits in seven innings
column6: struck out a career - high eight and walked two . It was the fourth big league appearance for the 26 - year - old right - hander
column7: who went 0 - 1 in three starts with Washington last season . 	 " He did a nice job
column8: " Rays manager Joe Maddon said . " That really exceeded expectations . " 	 Karns was recalled Friday from Triple - A Durham
column9: where he 'd been due to start Game 4 of the Governor 's Cup series against Pawtucket . He took the rotation spot of Drew Smyly when Tampa Bay decided to end the left - hander 's season after a career - high 153 innings . 	 Even though the Rays are well out of the playoff race
column10: Karns did n't need time to think when asked where he 'd rather be pitching . 	 " Any time you can pitch in the big leagues
column11: you ca n't take it for granted
column12: " Karns said . " I would definitely say this
column14: is a little bit more special . " 	 After going 9 - 9 with a 5.08 ERA in 27 starts at Triple - A
column15: Karns labored through a 25 - pitch first inning . He walked two batters and hit a third
column16: but he benefited from a double play . 	 " The nerves where a little overwhelming at first but then they wore off and everything settled in
column17: " Karns said . 	 Toronto did n't get its first hit until the fourth
column18: when Danny Valencia hit a two - out double past a diving Brandon Guyer in left . Karns ended the inning by throwing a called third strike past Kevin Pillar . 	 Karns retired 10 of his 11 batters
column19: allowing only Adam Lind 's two - out single in the sixth . He finished his outing by retiring two pinch hitters
column20: striking out Colby Rasmus and getting Munenori Kawasaki to fly out . 	 Jake McGee worked the eighth
column21: and Grant Balfour finished for his 12th save in 15 chances as the Rays won for the first time in three games . 	 Hanigan homered into the left - field bullpen on J.A Happ 's first pitch of the third . The homer was Hanigan 's first since June 16 against Baltimore . 	 " He was kind of challenging some guys there in the first two innings
column22: " Hanigan said . " I wanted to be aggressive if he was going to come in there and it worked out . " 	 Happ ( 9 - 10 ) allowed seven hits in seven innings
column23: struck out seven and walked one . It marked the 18th straight game that a Blue Jays starter has worked at least six innings
column24: Toronto 's longest streak since a 19 - game run in 1998 . 	 " If you love good pitching
column25: you saw it
column26: " Blue Jays manager John Gibbons said . 	 ROTATION SHUFFLE 	 Gibbons confirmed that LHP Mark Buehrle will start against the Rays Sunday
column27: with rookie RHP Marcus Stroman pushed back to face Baltimore on Monday . Buehrle is 2 - 0 with a 2.08 ERA in five starts against Tampa Bay this season . Coupled with Thursday 's off day
column28: Stroman will get two extra days of rest . 	 RAYS SIGN WAGNER 	 Tampa Bay signed RHP Neil Wagner to a two - year minor league deal Friday . Wagner was released by Toronto earlier this month after undergoing Tommy John elbow surgery in August . Wagner
column29: 2 - 4 with a 4.92 ERA in 52 career games
column30: is expected to miss the 2015 season . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Blue Jays SS Jose Reyes was awarded first base after it appeared he had been hit on his left hand by a pitch in the eighth . While Reyes was being examined by the trainer
column31: Maddon came out to challenge
column32: saying McGee 's pitch had hit the knob of the bat . The call was overturned following a video review
column33: and Reyes popped out . 	 UP NEXT 	 Rays RHP Jeremy Hellickson ( 1 - 3 ) faces Blue Jays RHP R.A. Dickey ( 12 - 12 ) on Saturday . Dickey has won his past three decisions
column34: while the Rays have lost six straight games started by Hellickson . 	 The Yankees hired former Mets manager Luis Rojas as their new third - base coach on Monday . 	 Detroit got a jump - start on the winter signings
column35: landing lefty Eduardo Rodriguez . We break down the deal . 	 In a free - agent field filled with future Hall of Famers
column36: Detroit added one of the most undervalued pitchers available this winter . 	 Joon Lee breaks down how Eduardo Rodriguez signing with Detroit affects the Tigers and Red Sox . 	 Check out some of the most electric moments from Vladimir Guerrero Jr. 's career . 	 Former Boston Red Sox left - hander Eduardo Rodriguez and the Detroit Tigers are in agreement on a five - year deal worth $ 77 million
column37: sources confirmed to ESPN .

column1: DETROIT -- Alex Avila chased a popup back behind the plate
column2: and with his momentum carrying him toward the crowd
column3: he had little choice but to hope the screen would hold his 5 - foot-11
column4: 210 - pound frame . 	 " Not exactly something you plan
column5: " the Detroit catcher said . " I 'm not the lightest guy . You never know . " 	 Avila went leaping into the screen while catching that foul pop
column6: and the Tigers jumped back into first place Friday night with a 7 - 2 victory over the Cleveland Indians . J.D. Martinez homered
column7: tripled and drove in four runs
column8: and David Price pitched into the eighth inning to help Detroit move a half - game ahead of Kansas City atop the division . 	 The Royals lost 4 - 2 to Boston
column9: giving Detroit sole possession of first place for the first time since the morning of Aug. 11 . 	 Martinez broke a 1 - all tie in the fourth with a two - run homer
column10: and then drove in two more runs with his triple in the seventh . Price ( 14 - 11 ) allowed a home run to Ryan Raburn in the second but kept Cleveland off the scoreboard after that . 	 If the Tigers win the division they can thank Martinez
column11: who has 21 home runs . He had never hit more than 11 in a season when Detroit signed him to a minor league deal in March . 	 " He 's certainly been a huge find for Detroit
column12: " Indians manager Terry Francona said . " He started the season in Triple - A
column13: and now he 's hitting fifth for them . Having him makes getting through Miggy [ Cabrera ] and Victor [ Martinez ] a whole lot harder
column14: and that 's huge for them . " 	 Cleveland starter Carlos Carrasco ( 7 - 5 ) allowed four runs and seven hits in 6⅓ innings . The Indians are four games out in the race for the second American League wild card . 	 Avila made the defensive play of the night when Mike Aviles hit a foul popup behind the plate in the fifth . Avila made the catch while jumping into the screen
column15: which served almost like a trampoline
column16: sagging backward while the Detroit catcher remained mostly upright and bounced off it . 	 " It was a nice catch
column17: " said Tigers manager Brad Ausmus
column18: a former catcher . " I would have caught it without the jump
column19: but he was nice . " 	 With Cleveland up 1 - 0 in the third
column20: Ian Kinsler lined an RBI double to right . J.D. Martinez 's homer made it 3 - 1 in the fourth . 	 Victor Martinez added an RBI single in the seventh
column21: and J.D. Martinez followed with a triple to right - center that made it 6 - 1 . Avila added an RBI infield single . 	 LOOKING LIKE AN ACE 	 Detroit won for only the fourth time in eight starts by Price
column22: acquired in a blockbuster trade at the July 31 deadline . The left - hander has allowed a couple of big innings since joining the Tigers
column23: but he also has shown plenty of his All - Star form . Price allowed a run and eight hits Friday in 7⅔ innings
column24: with seven strikeouts and no walks . 	 " Just staying focused
column25: staying with my process
column26: " Price said . " I know the stuff that I possess out there on the mound is good enough to get teams out
column27: it 's good enough to be dominant . I just want to be able to pitch as deep as possible into the game . " 	 STREAK HALTED 	 Carrasco had won four straight decisions since rejoining Cleveland 's rotation Aug. 10 -- and he had allowed only three runs in 38⅔ innings . 	 Included in that stretch was an unusual outing against the Tigers on Sept. 2
column28: when he allowed 10 hits in 5⅓ innings while also striking out 10 . That ended up being a no - decision . 	 He struck out five and walked two on Friday . 	 " I had a good fastball
column29: and I wanted to attack them
column30: but I did n't make enough pitches
column31: " Carrasco said . " I threw a sinker to [ J.D. ] Martinez
column32: and it just stayed right in the middle of the plate and he hit it out . " 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Indians : Aviles doubled in the second
column33: a day after he returned from a nine - day absence due to a concussion . He appeared in both games of a doubleheader against Minnesota on Thursday . 	 Tigers : Ausmus said LHP Phil Coke ( back ) is day - to - day . 	 UP NEXT 	 Detroit LHP Kyle Lobstein ( 1 - 0 ) takes the mound Saturday night against Cleveland RHP Danny Salazar ( 6 - 7 )

column1: NEW YORK -- Stalking off the mound
column2: Gio Gonzalez slammed the ball hard into Matt Williams ' hand without a word . 	 Back in the dugout
column3: Gonzalez had a little more to say to the Washington manager . The pitcher covered his mouth with a towel for a brief -- and lively -- chat with Williams . 	 " He was upset
column5: " Williams said after the Nationals lost to the New York Mets 4 - 3 Friday night . 	 Gonzalez was pulled with two outs and no one on base in the seventh inning when Williams wanted a reliever to face Juan Lagares . In the fifth
column6: Lagares hit a tiebreaking double that helped end the Nationals ' 12 - game winning streak at Citi Field . 	 " We tried our best to diffuse it
column7: " Gonzalez said . " It 's not bigger than it is . " 	 " There 's two sides of that story
column9: " he said . 	 Williams said he realized his lefty wanted to stay in the game . Asked whether he spoke to Gonzalez about showing such emotion
column10: Williams said : " That 's part of the game
column11: and that was our discussion . " 	 The Mets ' losing streak at Citi Field versus Washington dated to last season
column12: and was their longest in team history against a visiting club . 	 " Well
column14: and we have played them good . They are just really tough
column15: " Mets manager Terry Collins said . 	 " There has been a lot of nights where we have had them late in the game and then they come back
column16: do some big damage against us
column17: " he said . 	 Washington almost did it again in the ninth inning . Denard Span led off with a single against Jenrry Mejia
column18: and Asdrubal Cabrera flied out to the wall . After Span stole his 30th base
column19: Mejia struck out Anthony Rendon
column20: walked Adam LaRoche and then fanned Ian Desmond for his 26th save in 28 chances . 	 Rendon got three hits
column21: including his 20th homer -- which came after a replay reversal . Washington has outhomered the Mets 32 - 6 over their past 13 meetings in New York . 	 Dillon Gee ( 7 - 7 ) and a trio of Mets relievers ended the drought
column22: aided when Lagares drove in Eric Young Jr. for a 4 - 3 lead . 	 Travis d'Arnaud put New York ahead with a bases - loaded double in the first off Gonzalez ( 8 - 10 ) . Three runs scored on the hit
column23: with Lucas Duda kicking the ball out of catcher Wilson Ramos ' glove for an error . 	 In his past eight games
column24: d'Arnaud has five doubles and seven RBIs . 	 LaRoche and Ramos hit RBI singles in the third
column25: and Rendon hit a solo homer in the fifth that made it 3 - all . 	 Gee gave up nine hits and two walks in 5⅓ innings . Carlos Torres threw a double - play ball to end the sixth and worked the seventh
column26: Jeurys Familia pitched the eighth and Mejia closed . 	 Lagares also singled
column27: was hit by a pitch and stole a base . 	 Mets rookie second baseman Dilson Herrera boxed around several grounders . But he also went back for a tricky catch on Cabrera 's soft liner with the bases loaded to end the second . 	 A day after Bartolo Colon was ejected for hitting two Washington batters with pitches following home runs and a Mets batter got nicked
column28: Williams predicted there would n't be any carry - over from the " shenanigans . " 	 There were a couple of early HBPs
column29: but no hostility . Lagares was plunked by Washington for the third straight series
column30: and Span was hit by Gee on a pitch that bounced . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Nationals : RF Jayson Werth did n't start
column31: a day after he was hit above the left elbow by a pitch from Colon . Williams said Werth was n't out because of the plunking
column32: rather it was a day of rest for " dead legs . " 	 Mets : 2B Daniel Murphy was out of the lineup
column33: a day after he was hit in the left wrist by a pitch from Nationals reliever Matt Thornton . Collins said the wrist was swollen
column34: but that Murphy said he thought he 'd miss only one day . 	 UP NEXT 	 Nationals : RHP Doug Fister ( 13 - 6
column35: 2.53 ERA ) starts Saturday night . He beat Atlanta in his most recent outing
column36: ending a four - start winless string . 	 Mets : RHP Zack Wheeler ( 10 - 9
column37: 3.38 ) gets the ball Saturday night . He won at Washington on Aug. 5 and is 2 - 4 against the Nationals overall . 	 CHALLENGING 	 Collins challenged after Desmond was ruled safe at first in the fifth inning
column38: beating out a double - play relay . The review upheld the call . Desmond promptly stole second but overslid the bag and appeared to get tagged before he returned to the bag . With the Mets out of challenges
column40: Desmond was safe again . 	 Randy Arozarena celebrates with his family at home after learning he won the 2021 AL Rookie of the Year . 	 From MVP to Cy Young and more

column2: Texas --   Robinson Chirinos is back . So is Derek Holland . The catcher and pitcher led Texas to the win on Friday night . 	 Chirinos hit a tiebreaking RBI single in the eighth inning
column3: sending the Rangers to a 2 - 1 victory over the Atlanta Braves . 	 " ( Teammates ) were putting ( together ) good at - bats
column4: " Chirinos said . " So I was just trying to get a good pitch and trying to do my job and hit a line drive somewhere . It was good to be back in the game . " 	 Chirinos was playing for the first time after missing 10 games because of a stiff neck . 	 " It was nice to see his energy back there
column5: " interim manager Tim Bogar said . " He handled Derek well . " 	 Holland
column6: who missed five months following offseason knee surgery
column7: allowed one run and eight hits in seven innings in his third start of the year . The left - hander struck out six and walked none . 	 Holland has not allowed a walk since he returned . The only other Rangers pitcher with no walks in three consecutive starts of seven innings or more was Hall of Famer Ferguson Jenkins in 1979 . 	 " A walk is a free base
column8: " Holland said . " I 'm not giving my teammates a chance to make plays when I do that . It would be nice to keep up this no walks going
column9: but I ca n't get caught up in it . " 	 Adrian Beltre and Ryan Rua had two hits apiece as Texas won for only the second time in 13 games . The Rangers improved to 2 - 5 under Bogar . 	 The Braves have lost four of five to drop three games behind Pittsburgh for the National League 's second wild card . 	 Texas ' winning rally started with two out in the eighth . Beltre and Rua hit consecutive singles against David Carpenter ( 6 - 4 ) before Chirinos lined a single to center to give the Rangers a 2 - 1 lead . 	 Rookie Phil Klein ( 1 - 2 ) recorded two outs for his first major league win and Neftali Feliz pitched a perfect ninth inning for his ninth save in 10 opportunities . 	 Atlanta had a runner on third with one out in the eighth when Klein struck out Justin Upton . After an intentional walk to Ryan Doumit
column10: Klein struck out Chris Johnson to end the inning . 	 The game ended when Atlanta 's Andrelton Simmons flied out to right fielder Michael Choice on the warning track . 	 Atlanta 's Alex Wood allowed only one run and four hits in seven innings . 	 Singles by B.J. Upton and Simmons and Jason Heyward 's ground ball produced the Braves ' run in the third inning . Holland retired Justin Upton and Doumit with the bases loaded . 	 Texas tied it in the sixth on J.P. Arencibia 's double
column11: Beltre 's single and Rua 's groundout . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Braves : C Evan Gattis ( strep throat ) missed his fourth straight game . column2: Mo. --   One season after winning the World Series
column3: the Boston Red Sox are playing spoiler -- and doing all they can to extend a playoff drought in Kansas City that 's lasted nearly three decades . 	 Allen Webster pitched six solid innings and Jemile Weeks stroked a pair of doubles and scored two runs as the Red Sox defeated the sputtering Royals 4 - 2 on Friday night . 	 Kansas City lost for the fourth time in five games and fell out of first place in the AL Central for the first time since Aug. 10 . The Royals
column4: who are 0 - 5 against the last - place Red Sox
column5: dropped a half - game behind Detroit
column6: which beat Cleveland 7 - 2 . 	 " Any time you can spoil it for another team is big
column8: who had allowed 15 runs on 16 hits and seven walks in 13 2/3 innings over his previous three starts
column9: limited the Royals to four hits -- including Eric Hosmer 's two - run homer in the fourth . 	 " I just tried to forget about it and attack hitters
column10: " Webster said . " Attack them and let the defense work behind me . " 	 Weeks
column11: who had a two - run double in the ninth inning Thursday
column12: doubled in the third and fifth . Mookie Betts singled home Weeks in a three - run third . He scored again on Daniel Nava 's two - out single in the fifth . 	 " They 're in the hunt
column13: " Betts said . " Since we 're not in it
column14: we might as well put everybody else out of it that we can
column15: but mostly we 're just having fun playing the game . " 	 The Royals
column16: who have not reached the postseason since winning the 1985 World Series
column17: are having anything but fun . 	 " I think everyone is trying a little bit too hard
column18: " Alex Gordon said . " It 's just not coming together right now . There 's a lot going on just because we 're in the middle of a pennant race and we 're not swinging well . We 've got to move on . 	 " I think it 's just frustration . I do n't think pressing as ( much as ) it is frustrating . The pitching is doing the job . We just need to step up and forget about what we did tonight . " 	 The Royals aided the Red Sox in the third
column19: with Betts scoring on third baseman Mike Moustakas ' throwing error and Nava scoring on Yordano Ventura 's wild pitch . 	 " We definitely could have played better
column20: " Royals manager Ned Yost said . 	 Ventura ( 12 - 10 )
column21: who had won his previous three starts
column22: gave up four runs -- three earned -- and seven hits in seven innings . He also hit two batters with pitches . 	 Red Sox relievers Tommy Layne
column24: Koji Uehara and Edward Mujica held the Royals hitless for the final three innings . Mujica earned his sixth save . 	 GOT YOUR NUMBER 	 Red Sox pitchers are 5 - 0 with a 1.80 ERA this season against the Royals
column25: holding them to a .206 batting average and nine extra - base hits . column26: who missed his turn Thursday with a tender shoulder
column27: made about 30 throws at 75 feet on flat ground . He said his goal is to make his next start

column1: MILWAUKEE -- Lyle Overbay 's aggressive approach with the bases loaded in the ninth inning paid off for the Milwaukee Brewers . 	 The veteran left - handed hitter had struck out two innings earlier on a steady diet of pitches down and away in the zone . Overbay was determined not to let the Cincinnati Reds do that to him again
column2: especially with the game on the line . 	 Overbay 's game - ending RBI single off the first pitch from Jumbo Diaz with one out lifted Milwaukee to a 3 - 2 win Friday night that helped the Brewers keep pace in the National League playoff race . 	 The Brewers won their third straight to stay 1½ games back of Pittsburgh for the second NL wild card . 	 " I wanted to make sure I did n't miss it
column3: " Overbay said when asked if he was looking to hit the first pitch . " The at - bat before I was a little tentative and they were pounding me low and away . " 	 The pitch from Diaz ( 0 - 1 ) was down
column4: but more in the middle of the zone . Overbay squared up and went the opposite way to the gap in left - center
column5: allowing pinch runner Logan Schafer to jog home for the winning run . 	 Overbay made the Reds pay for intentionally walking Ryan Braun and Gerardo Parra to get to him . 	 " We were just trying to get a ground ball
column6: forceout at home plate and trying to get a double play
column7: " Reds catcher Brayan Pena said . " It was meant to be down
column9: but he got a pretty good swing on it and they won the game . " 	 Teammates mobbed Overbay as he rounded first base . The crowd celebrated by putting two arms up to form a circle in the shape of an " O " for Overbay . 	 " That was one of the coolest things in a while
column10: since I actually looked up and saw it
column11: " Overbay said . " That was pretty cool . " 	 MILESTONE 	 Jonathan Lucroy had a leadoff double in the ninth for Milwaukee . It was his 44th double as a catcher this season
column12: tying the National League record set last year by St. Louis ' Yadier Molina . 	 NERVOUS NINTH 	 Cincinnati had a chance to go in front in the top of the ninth against Francisco Rodriguez ( 5 - 5 ) . 	 Brandon Phillips led off with a four - pitch walk and made it to third on a sacrifice and groundout . After Zack Cozart walked
column13: pinch hitter Jack Hannahan struck out looking on a 3 - 2 fastball . 	 Hannahan was so unhappy with the call that he had to be restrained by manager Bryan Price . Hannahan ended up getting ejected by plate umpire Dan Iassogna . 	 It only got worse for Cincinnati
column14: which had won three in a row . 	 SPOT START 	 Cincinnati wasted a surprising outing by spot starter Daniel Corcino
column15: who allowed just two hits and two runs in six innings . He filled in for the injured Mat Latos . 	 Corcino even got his first big league hit on a single in the third . He was told Thursday he might be needed to start against Milwaukee . 	 " As soon as I get to the mound I forgot about everything . You know
column16: you 've got to do the job
column17: " Corcino said . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Reds : Latos was a late scratch with a bone bruise in his right elbow . The right - hander missed the first 2½ months of the season with right elbow and left knee injuries . 	 Price said Corcino would replace Latos again if he ca n't make his next start . 	 Brewers : LF Khris Davis was out of the starting lineup for a second straight day with right forearm tightness . Davis
column18: who has a team - high 22 homers
column19: will likely start on Saturday
column20: manager Ron Roenicke said . 	 UP NEXT : 	 Reds : LHP David Holmberg ( 0 - 1 ) threw 5⅔ scoreless innings on Monday after replacing injured starter Dylan Axelrod . Now
column21: Holmberg gets the start Saturday for his first career appearance against Milwaukee . 	 Brewers : RHP Yovani Gallardo ( 8 - 9 ) will try to snap out of a tough stretch after going 0 - 3 with a 5.95 ERA in his past four starts . column1: ST . LOUIS -- Adam Wainwright snapped out of a midseason funk with a complete game in his previous start for St. Louis
column2: and Colorado saw a pitcher who still had shutdown stuff . 	 " When I 'm cruising
column4: throwing all my pitches for strikes
column5: trusting my defense and pounding the bottom of the zone
column6: " Wainwright said after earning his 18th win in the Cardinals ' 5 - 1 victory on Friday night . " So
column8: usually things work out right . " 	 Matt Holliday hit a long three - run homer to left in the first inning for the Cardinals
column9: who stopped a three - game losing streak . The distance of Holliday 's 17th homer was estimated at 467 feet . 	 " It 's fun to hit one like that
column10: " Holliday said . " I hit that about as good as I can hit a ball . " 	 Wainwright ( 18 - 9 ) allowed one run and six hits in eight innings with eight strikeouts and no walks . He retired his final 16 batters while improving to 7 - 1 against Colorado and matching Clayton Kershaw and Johnny Cueto for the major league lead in wins . 	 Wainwright noted that Colorado 's lineup is not as formidable without Troy Tulowitzki and Carlos Gonzalez . 	 " They 're missing two of the best hitters in baseball and they 're still a very good lineup
column11: " Wainwright said . " Guys all through the order can hit home runs . " 	 Holliday ended a nine - game RBI drought and homered for the first time this month
column12: sending a drive off Jorge De La Rosa ( 13 - 11 ) into Big Mac Land beyond left field . It was the second - longest homer at 9 - year - old Busch Stadium behind Holliday 's 469 - foot drive against the Chicago Cubs ' Ryan Dempster on July 20
column13: 2012 . 	 The NL Central - leading Cardinals stayed 2 1/2 games ahead of second - place Pittsburgh . 	 De La Rosa allowed four runs -- three earned -- and four hits in six innings . Colorado has scored just three runs during a four - game losing streak . They had been shut out the previous two games in New York against the Mets . 	 " We had a lot of good at - bats
column14: " said eighth - place hitter D.J. LeMahieu
column15: who was 0 for 4 with nothing out of the infield . " We lined out three or four times . We definitely had better at - bats than the New York series
column16: that 's for sure . " 	 De La Rosa got off to a rough start . He walked Matt Carpenter and gave up Randal Grichuk 's infield hit before Holliday connected . 	 " I did n't have my best stuff
column17: " De La Rosa said . " I tried to make them put the ball in the play and my only mistake was to Holliday . It was supposed to be away and he hit it really good . " 	 Colorado
column18: which entered first in the NL with a .274 average and 665 runs
column19: went 2 for 9 with runners in scoring position . Nolan Arenado 's RBI double off the base of the left - field wall in the third ended a 21 - inning scoreless drought on what Wainwright described as perhaps the " best swing I 've ever seen on my curveball on a ball that was about 56 feet . " 	 Yadier Molina 's RBI double in the eighth was his first extra - base hit since July 9 . Grichuk had a hit and a walk and is batting .414 ( 12 for 29 ) since being recalled Aug. 29 . 	 St. Louis has won 20 of its last 28 against the Rockies . column1: PHOENIX --   Eric Stults got a little support for a change

column3: extending the Diamondbacks ' losing streak to a season - worst seven games . column19: one earned

column2: Calif. -- Even after a late flight home from Texas led into an early three - run deficit
column3: the Los Angeles Angels ' incredible late - season offensive barrage still would n't stop . 	 David Freese hit a two - run homer and Mike Trout had an RBI triple during Los Angeles ' seven - run fifth inning
column4: and the Angels beat the Houston Astros 11 - 3 Friday night for their ninth consecutive victory . 	 Kole Calhoun had a tiebreaking
column5: two - run single in the fifth for the major league - leading Angels ( 92 - 55 )
column6: who began their final homestand by reducing their magic number to five for their first AL West title since 2009 . They lead spiraling Oakland
column8: by 11 games with 15 to play . 	 " We 're just playing good baseball
column10: who had his 12th three - hit game of the season . " Confidence is huge
column11: and it just seems like we 're all playing together . There 's never a panic mode . It 's been fun coming to the yard every day . " 	 Trout had an RBI double in the fourth and Howie Kendrick added a two - run double in the sixth for Los Angeles . The Angels have won 15 of 17 overall
column12: highlighted by their longest winning streak since August 2004 . 	 After a slow start in their first game back from a 10 - day
column14: the Angels obliterated Houston 's early 3 - 0 lead with another eye - popping night from the majors ' most productive offense . Los Angeles has scored at least seven runs in eight consecutive games
column15: matching the 1979 franchise record . 	 " It 's certainly a good time for it
column16: " Angels manager Mike Scioscia said . " They cracked the door open for us a little bit
column17: and then ( we got ) just some key hits all the way around . " 	 The Angels scored 70 runs during their eight - game road streak
column18: and they increased that crazy offensive pace in their return to the Big A
column19: trouncing the only team that has beaten them since Aug. 25 . The Astros took two straight from Los Angeles early last week . 	 Brett Oberholtzer ( 5 - 11 ) could n't get through the fifth for the Astros
column20: who had won eight of 10 . 	 " They 're a good team
column22: " Houston interim manager Tom Lawless said . " There 's no doubt about that . So if we do n't play a clean game ... we made a miscue here
column24: and they just took advantage of it . That 's what good teams do . " 	 The Angels had seven hits in the fifth
column25: scoring their first run of the inning when Jake Marisnick dropped Collin Cowgill 's fly ball in right for an error . Calhoun
column26: Trout and Albert Pujols all drove in runs before Freese 's eighth homer
column27: his second in 42 games . 	 " I just missed it
column28: " Marisnick said . " I just dropped it . The ball has got to be caught . It was a big point in the game and it gave them some momentum . " 	 C.J. Wilson ( 12 - 9 ) struggled just to reach the fifth
column29: but the Angels ' offense secured his second straight victory . The inconsistent left - hander gave up seven hits and struck out six . 	 Marisnick
column30: from nearby Riverside
column31: got a 20 - foot RBI single in the first inning when Wilson and catcher Chris Iannetta could n't field his bases - loaded topper cleanly . 	 Los Angeles maintained its four - game lead over Baltimore ( 88 - 59 ) for the majors ' best record . 	 CHALLENGE ACCEPTED 	 Robbie Grossman reached first in the fourth inning when Lawless successfully challenged a call for the first time as the Astros ' manager . Replays showed C.J. Cron had n't applied a tag after catching an errant throw from Erick Aybar . Grossman came around to score on Dexter Fowler 's double . 	 BEARD AND WEIRD 	 Before the game
column32: Angels President Tim Carpino donned a fake black beard as he presented the AL pitcher of the month award to right - hander Matt Shoemaker . The executive 's phony facial hair was even bigger than Shoemaker 's tonsorial trademark . Several Angels reserves also wore fake beards for a group photo with Shoemaker . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Angels : Cleanup hitter Josh Hamilton missed his eighth straight game with an injured right shoulder
column33: and the offense again did n't miss him . The 2010 AL MVP 's return is still uncertain . ... LHP Joe Thatcher was activated from the disabled list after a six - week absence with a sprained ankle . 	 UP NEXT 	 Astros RHP Scott Feldman ( 8 - 10

column1: SEATTLE -- Before beginning the most important home series of the season
column2: Seattle coach Lloyd McClendon had a brief message . 	 The playoffs for the Mariners start now . 	 " I told my guys
column3: this is real simple . This is really playoff baseball
column6: all those things are out the window . What you did against a guy last time really makes no difference . It 's all about grinding your at - bats out
column7: staying in your inner circle and believing in each other . If you do that you have a good chance to get it done . " 	 Clearly McClendon 's team paid attention
column8: and now Seattle is just a half - game behind in the AL wild - card chase after beating Oakland 4 - 2 on Friday night . 	 Robinson Cano
column9: Kendrys Morales and Logan Morrison all homered as Seattle took another chunk out of Oakland 's wild - card lead that was double digits in early August . Seattle and Kansas City are tied behind the A 's
column10: who have dropped 12 of their last 15 . 	 Cano hit his 13th homer in the first inning and Morrison added his eighth in the fifth inning
column11: both off Jason Hammel ( 10 - 11 ) . Morales hit a line drive out to right - center field off Eric O'Flaherty in the sixth . 	 " We played a good game today
column12: but we have to be ready for tomorrow
column13: " Cano said . 	 Seattle starter James Paxton ( 6 - 2 ) pitched six innings despite control trouble . Paxton walked three batters in the third inning alone
column14: but struck out eight and three times left runners stranded in scoring position . 	 Fernando Rodney pitched the ninth for his 45th save despite giving up a pair of singles to open the inning . Rodney tied Kazuhiro Sasaki 's franchise record for saves in a season . Rodney did n't know about the record until being told postgame . 	 " It 's a lot of saves
column16: but 16 games left want to continue it rolling
column17: pitch good and make good pitches
column18: " Rodney said . " It 's a good series we have in here right now with Oakland and we see what happens tomorrow . " 	 Cano 's homer skimmed the top of the left - field wall and gave Seattle a 1 - 0 lead . Morrison 's drive curled inside the right - field foul pole
column19: breaking a 2 - 2 tie . Morrison 's homer came at the same time fireworks erupted across the street at CenturyLink Field when the Seattle Sounders scored in their MLS match with Real Salt Lake . 	 Seattle also got a bloop RBI double from Mike Zunino that Oakland left fielder Jonny Gomes appeared to lose in the lights . 	 PITCHER AT THE PLATE 	 Hammel was lifted after the fifth despite throwing just 78 pitches
column20: partly because of issues with Oakland 's batting order . The A 's lost their designated hitter in the bottom of the third inning when Geovany Soto left with back spasms . Derek Norris took over behind the plate but the A 's lost their DH in the move . 	 Hammel batted in the top of the fourth and reached on a fielder 's choice after an errant throw allowed Nate Freiman to reach second . Freiman later scored on Sam Fuld 's bunt to pull Oakland even at 2 - 2 . 	 " Kind of unlucky the way it went tonight
column21: " Hammel said . " Both pitches that left he yard I would throw them again . " 	 SERIES CLINCHER 	 Seattle clinched the season series against Oakland with its 10th win over the A 's . The Mariners have won consecutive season series over the A 's for the first time since taking three straight from 2001 - 03 . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Athletics : Oakland closer Sean Doolittle was reinstated from the 15 - day disabled list after being out with a strained right intercostal muscle . Manager Bob Melvin said Doolittle 's return should settle the A 's bullpen . 	 Mariners : OF Dustin Ackley was back in the lineup after missing four games with soreness in his foot and ankle . Manager Lloyd McClendon said Ackley should be able to make it through the final 17 games . 	 UP NEXT 	 Athletics : Sonny Gray ( 13 - 8) is 1 - 4 with a 5.32 ERA in seven starts since Aug. 6 . He does love pitching in Seattle with a 3 - 0 record and 0.46 ERA in three starts at Safeco Field . 	 Mariners : Felix Hernandez ( 14 - 5 ) makes what could be his final home start of the regular season . Hernandez has at least two more road starts and could pitch the final day of the regular season at home or be held for a potential wild - card game . Hernandez is 19 - 7 in his career against Oakland and 4 - 0 with a 2.15 ERA in five starts this year . 	 The Yankees hired former Mets manager Luis Rojas as their new third - base coach on Monday . 	 Detroit got a jump - start on the winter signings
column22: landing lefty Eduardo Rodriguez . We break down the deal . 	 In a free - agent field filled with future Hall of Famers
column23: Detroit added one of the most undervalued pitchers available this winter . 	 Joon Lee breaks down how Eduardo Rodriguez signing with Detroit affects the Tigers and Red Sox . 	 Check out some of the most electric moments from Vladimir Guerrero Jr. 's career . 	 Former Boston Red Sox left - hander Eduardo Rodriguez and the Detroit Tigers are in agreement on a five - year deal worth $ 77 million

column1: SAN FRANCISCO -- Madison Bumgarner pitched himself into the San Francisco record book
column2: took a share of the major league lead for wins and
column3: most important to the soft - spoken southpaw
column4: moved his team one step closer in an NL West race that could go down to the wire . 	 Bumgarner struck out eight on the way to his 18th victory
column5: and the Giants moved within one game of NL West - leading Los Angeles by beating the Dodgers 9 - 0 on Friday night . 	 " It 's not hard to get up for the Dodgers series
column7: " Bumgarner said . " The offense did an unbelievable job and kept scoring runs . " 	 Pinch hitter Travis Ishikawa splashed a three - run homer into McCovey Cove
column8: and Brandon Crawford hit a two - run drive in the fifth to help Bumgarner win his fifth straight start . Buster Posey and Crawford hit RBI doubles in the first as the Giants jumped on Hyun - Jin Ryu ( 14 - 7 ) . 	 The Dodgers ' left - hander exited after only one inning because of irritation in his pitching shoulder . He said it 's similar to the problem he dealt with in May that landed him on the disabled list
column9: raising doubt whether he will pitch again this season . 	 Ryu will be re - examined Saturday in the Bay Area . 	 " I 'm staying positive . I felt this before in the past
column10: so hopefully it will be the same time that it took to recover from that
column11: " Ryu said through a translator . " I think it was a week or two . " 	 San Francisco
column12: which leads the NL wild - card race
column13: is one game back of Los Angeles for the first time since Aug. 4 . The Giants have won a season - best 10 straight home games after handing the Dodgers their fifth shutout loss . column14: " Bumgarner said . " We 've got a lot of guys who have been here and done this before . " 	 Bumgarner ( 18 - 9 ) reached 200 strikeouts for the first time in his career when he fanned Scott Van Slyke in the second . The lefty is tied with Dodgers Sunday starter Clayton Kershaw

column2: Texas --   Lisalverto Bonilla made it through six innings in his first major league start when Texas manager Tim Bogar would have been more than happy with five . 	 The 24 - year - old right - hander 's reward came from fellow rookie Rougned Odor
column3: whose two - run double in the sixth put the last - place Rangers ahead and gave Bonilla the win in a 3 - 2 interleague victory Saturday over the NL wild card - chasing Atlanta Braves . 	 " Amazed . How 's that ? " Bogar offered with a smile when he asked if there was something beyond " ecstatic
column4: " the word he used for how he would feel if Bonilla went five innings on a pitch count of roughly 75 . " I was really happy with how he did . " 	 Atlanta 's Julio Teheran ( 13 - 12 ) took a no - hitter and a 2 - 0 lead into the sixth before a one - out single by Luis Sardinas . 	 An error by left fielder Justin Upton kept the inning alive
column5: and Elvis Andrus had an RBI single before Odor doubled to the warning track in left - center field
column6: scoring Leonys Martin and Andrus . 	 The Braves
column7: who started the day three games behind Pittsburgh for the second NL wild - card spot
column8: dropped to 2 - 6 on their nine - game road trip . 	 Bonilla ( 1 - 0 )
column9: filling in after Scott Baker was scratched with triceps tendinitis
column10: got through his six innings in 78 pitches despite four walks and three straight batters reaching in Atlanta 's two - run third . 	 He erased leadoff walks in the first and third by getting double - play grounders from Phil Gosselin and Christian Bethancourt . He followed each of the double plays with a walk but escaped further damage . 	 " Sometimes I was trying to be too fine on my pitches and that 's why I have problems with my control
column12: whose first two career appearances were out of the bullpen
column13: said through a translator . 	 With closer Neftali Feliz unavailable
column14: Neal Cotts pitched the ninth for his first save this season . 	 Teheran faded after a strong start for the second straight outing as the Braves dropped the first two of a three - game set in Texas . He struck out six in his fourth complete game of the season
column15: and the only three hits he gave up were in the sixth . 	 " I was n't disappointed about the no - hitter
column16: " the 23 - year - old right - hander said . " I was just trying to keep the lead and win the game . The whole game I felt good . " 	 Teheran retired 13 of the first 14 last Sunday at Miami but allowed seven of the next nine to reach in a 4 - 0 loss . The sixth got him this time
column17: but only after Upton 's two - out error when he tried to make a running catch and dropped a line drive from Martin . 	 " Nobody feels worse about it than Justin
column18: " Braves manager Fredi Gonzalez said . " He makes that play 100 out of 100 times . He was coming in hard and it just bounced off his glove . It compounds it when we 're not scoring too many runs . " 	 RANGERS WITH RARE CHANCE 	 Texas goes for its first sweep since April on Sunday . The Rangers won consecutive games for the first time since Aug. 24 - 25 and just the third time since July 1 . They also have a chance to finish .500 ( 10 - 10 ) in interleague play . 	 MILD TEXAS SUMMER 	 The temperature at first pitch was 59
column19: the coolest since April 17 and 39 degrees lower than three nights earlier . It will go down as a mild summer for Texas baseball . The Rangers matched the coolest August gametime temperature at 71 and are n't likely to add to the only triple - digit first pitch on July 27 ( 100 degrees ) . column1: CHICAGO --   Jose Quintana struck out a career - high 13
column2: Alexei Ramirez homered and the Chicago White Sox beat the Minnesota Twins 5 - 1 in the opener of a doubleheader Saturday . 	 Quintana ( 8 - 10 ) allowed a run and two walks in seven innings . 	 Phil Hughes had a career - high 11 strikeouts
column3: and he became the first Twins pitcher to have double - digit strikeouts in an outing since Francisco Liriano on July 18
column5: against Baltimore . 	 Hughes ( 15 - 10 ) allowed five runs -- three earned -- in seven innings . 	 The Twins struck out 17 times while the White Sox fanned 12 times . 	 Ramirez had two hits . His two - run shot in the third opened the scoring . Carlos Sanchez scored on Ramirez 's 15th homer after reaching on first baseman Joe Mauer 's fielding error . Ramirez was 4 for 20 in his career against Hughes before connecting . 	 The White Sox extended their lead to 3 - 0 in the seventh on Andy Wilkins ' RBI single after Jordan Danks doubled . 	 The White Sox earned their first three - game win streak since July 24 - 26 . 	 Twins pinch - hitter Chris Parmelee had an RBI double in the eighth . 	 Quintana struck out six straight in the fifth and sixth innings . He exited after issuing a leadoff walk in the eighth after 111 pitches . Quintana needs 14 1/3 innings to reach 200 for the second consecutive season . 	 Hughes was lifted after allowing a leadoff double and hitting Jose Abreu in the eighth . Hughes

column2: and Saturday was another good day for the touted prospect . 	 Baez and fellow rookie Matt Szczur homered
column3: and the Chicago Cubs snapped a seven - game losing streak with a 6 - 4 victory over the Pittsburgh Pirates . 	 Baez connected for a two - run shot in Chicago 's three - run third
column4: and Szczur hit a leadoff drive in the eighth for his first career homer . It was Baez 's second homer in two nights and No . 9 on the season . 	 Baez is 4 - for-15 with two homers and three RBIs in his past four games after going 6 - for-62 with 28 strikeouts during a prolonged slump for the 21 - year - old infielder . 	 " I 'm just trying to go up to the plate with a good approach
column5: " Baez said . " I 've been working with [ hitting coach Bill Mueller ] and trying to have better at - bats . I 've felt more comfortable the last few days . " 	 Felix Doubront ( 2 - 1 ) pitched six scoreless innings for the Cubs in his third start since he was acquired in a trade with the Boston Red Sox . 	 Russell Martin hit a three - run double in the eighth for Pittsburgh
column6: which had won seven of eight . The Pirates ' lead for the second NL wild card stayed at 1½ games over Milwaukee
column7: which lost 5 - 1 to Cincinnati . 	 Travis Snider hit a leadoff homer in the ninth against Cubs closer Hector Rondon
column8: who then retired three in a row for his 24th save in 28 chances . 	 Arismendy Alcantara
column10: had two hits and two RBIs as the Cubs ended their worst losing streak of the season . Chicago also had lost seven straight games against Pittsburgh . 	 " It was a good team win
column11: " Cubs manager Rick Renteria said . " A lot of people contributed . " 	 Pittsburgh 's Jeff Locke ( 7 - 5 ) allowed three runs in 5⅓ innings
column12: throwing just 62 of 106 pitches for strikes . He lost for just the second time in his past seven decisions . 	 " I just did n't make pitches when I needed to in that [ third ] inning
column13: " Locke said . " It was the difference in the game because we came back and scored late . " 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Cubs : 1B Anthony Rizzo missed his 17th straight game with a lower back strain but remains on course to return to the lineup Monday night when Chicago hosts Cincinnati . 	 Pirates : LF Starling Marte sat out for the second game in a row with a bruised left arm and likely wo n't return to action until at least Tuesday for the opener of a three - game home series against Boston . 	 UP NEXT 	 RHP Jacob Turner ( 5 - 9
column14: 5.84 ERA ) is scheduled to start for the Cubs on Sunday against RHP Edinson Volquez ( 11 - 7
column15: 3.36 ERA ) in the finale of the three - game series . 	 Turner is 1 - 2 with a 6.19 ERA in three starts since being acquired Aug. 8 in a trade with Miami . Volquez is 3 - 0 with a 2.29 ERA in his past nine starts and has not lost since July 21 to the Dodgers . 	 HE GOT THE BALL
column16: EVENTUALLY 	 It seemed as if Szczur was in luck when a fan in the left - field bleachers threw his first home run ball back onto the field . 	 Snider retrieved the ball and tossed it to the ball girl along the left - field line
column17: but she gave it to a boy sitting in the stands . 	 At the end of the inning
column18: third - base umpire Paul Schrieber gave the young fan another ball in exchange for the Szczur ball . 	 Randy Arozarena hit 20 home runs and stole 20 bases this season

column2: Mo. -- Jeremy Guthrie walked out to the mound for the second inning and found he had something rare for a Kansas City Royals pitcher -- a two - run lead . 	 Guthrie retired the final 17 batters he faced
column3: Omar Infante had three hits and drove in two runs
column4: and the Royals beat the Boston Red Sox 7 - 1 on Saturday night . 	 Manager Ned Yost overhauled his batting order and got immediate results . The Royals scored seven runs for the first time since Aug. 19
column5: a span of 22 games . 	 " Breathing room
column6: we have n't had a whole bunch of that recently
column7: " Guthrie said . " I do n't know if you ever get too comfortable [ whether ] you have two or three runs . But once you get seven
column8: you 're a little more comfortable . " 	 The Royals remain a half - game behind Detroit in the AL Central standings . After losing four of their previous five games
column9: it was important for the Royals to keep pace with the Tigers . 	 " I think we 've approached all the games the same
column10: " Guthrie said . " That 's the easiest way to do it . I think if you try to approach every game differently -- like yesterday was less important
column11: and today 's and tomorrow 's are subtly important
column12: but Monday 's game is way more important . I think it is difficult to prepare like that . " 	 Nori Aoki
column13: batting second for the first time this season
column16: each had two hits
column17: scored a run and drove in a run . Alcides Escobar also had two hits
column18: including a double to start the game . 	 Infante
column19: who usually bats second
column20: was dropped to seventh and responded with three singles
column21: including an eighth - inning single that scored Lorenzo Cain . He also drove in a run in the third with a fielder 's choice . 	 " It was huge
column22: " Cain said of scoring two in the first . " We 've been struggling to score runs
column23: but to get two early was outstanding for us . We definitely need to score runs . We did a great job of that tonight
column24: but we 've got to keep doing it . " 	 Guthrie ( 11 - 11 )
column25: who was roughed up for eight runs on 10 hits in 2⅔ innings in a loss Monday at Detroit
column26: allowed three hits and one unearned run in eight innings . 	 " He was in control
column27: " Yost said . " He just pitched a great game . He was on tonight . " 	 After David Ortiz 's single in the third
column28: Guthrie did not allow a baserunner . 	 " He was very good
column29: " Red Sox manager John Farrell said . " We did n't really manufacture anything against him . " 	 Fifteen of Guthrie 's 24 outs were fly outs
column30: with center fielder Jarrod Dyson tracking down nine . 	 " He had the fly ball going for him
column31: " Red Sox center fielder Jackie Bradley Jr. said . " He was efficient with his pitches . " 	 Rubby De La Rosa ( 4 - 7 ) was pulled after four innings and 65 pitches
column32: permitting five runs on six hits . He balked home Salvador Perez
column33: who had an RBI double in the three - run third . 	 " Every time he walks to the mound it 's a good test
column34: regardless of the number of innings pitched in a given year
column35: " Farrell said . " We are limiting his innings pitched
column36: but we do n't want to shut him down . " 	 STEALING AWAY 	 Cain swiped his 25th base
column37: joining Dyson and Escobar in the 25 - steal club . The last time the Royals had three players steal 25 bases in a season was 1983 -- Willie Wilson
column38: John Washington and U.L. Washington . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Red Sox : INF Brock Holt remains sidelined with a concussion and there is no timetable for his return . He is still having vision problems . 	 Royals : LHP Danny Duffy
column39: who skipped a start Thursday with a sore shoulder
column40: is scheduled for a mound session Sunday . He is optimistic he will make his start Tuesday against Chicago . . DH Josh Willingham remains out with a groin injury . 	 UP NEXT 	 Red Sox : RHP Joe Kelly will make his eighth start since being acquired in a July 31 trade with St. Louis . He last faced the Royals on June 22
column41: 2012 . 	 Royals : LHP Jason Vargas will start the series finale . He is 6 - 4 with a 3.98 ERA at home this season . 	 From MVP to Cy Young and more

column1: NEW YORK --   With a versatile lineup that can generate offense in so many different ways
column2: the Washington Nationals definitely look like a dangerous team come October . 	 Bryce Harper homered
column3: Ian Desmond drove in three runs and Washington moved a step closer to its second NL East title in three years with a 10 - 3 victory over the New York Mets on Saturday night . 	 " We have a deep lineup
column4: " Desmond said . " It 's a good feeling for us . I 'm sure it 's not a very good feeling for the opposing team . There 's a lot of different threats . " 	 Anthony Rendon added to his huge series with four hits as the Nationals outhit New York 15 - 6 and reduced their magic number to six for clinching the division . Denard Span had a two - run homer in the ninth inning and scored three times . 	 " I 'm really happy with where we are as a team . We 're playing really good baseball
column5: " Desmond said . " It 's just an exciting time of the year for everybody . " 	 Doug Fister was handed a 6 - 0 lead and breezed to his fourth win in four career starts against the Mets -- all in the past 13 months . One night after their 12 - game winning streak at Citi Field was snapped
column6: the Nationals went right back to dominating New York on a dreary night in Queens . 	 Desmond got three hits and stole two bases . He also drew a leadoff walk from an ineffective Zack Wheeler ( 10 - 10 ) in the second before Harper launched a high drive down the right - field line that landed in the second deck for his 13th home run of the season . 	 Harper finished with three hits and Jayson Werth knocked in two runs to give Washington four players with at least 80 RBIs . 	 " The objective is to grind at - bats
column7: and we 've got a lot of guys on our club that do that
column8: " manager Matt Williams said . 	 Rendon is 10 for 15 with two homers in the four - game series that wraps up Sunday . He was answering questions from reporters at his locker when a teammate walked by and bellowed
column9: " What 's it like to wake up in the morning and be great ? You should know . " 	 " I 've been more relaxed . If I knew anything different or any change
column10: I guess I 'd never get out
column11: " Rendon said with a chuckle . " Fortunate series so far . " 	 Wilmer Flores hit a two - run homer and Juan Lagares had three hits for the sloppy Mets
column12: who have dropped 17 of their last 20 against Washington . They made three of their four errors on consecutive batters in the sixth -- right fielder Curtis Granderson even dropped a fly ball later in the game that turned into a forceout . 	 New York had won eight of 10 overall . 	 " When you do n't pitch
column13: the game is going to get ugly
column14: " manager Terry Collins said . 	 Working in a steady rain during the middle innings
column15: Fister ( 14 - 6 ) needed only 75 pitches to get through six . He gave up three runs -- two earned -- and five hits in his second consecutive win after losing three straight starts . The big right - hander has a 1.01 ERA against the Mets . 	 Wheeler threw 100 pitches in four - plus innings and was charged with six runs on seven hits . He was 7 - 1 with a 2.21 ERA in his previous 13 starts since June 29 . 	 " I did n't have my command . Whenever I did throw a strike
column16: something crazy happened
column17: " Wheeler said . " Something was wrong with my mechanics and I could n't figure it out . " 	 THE SHORT LIST 	 Desmond joined Hanley Ramirez and Alex Rodriguez as the only major league shortstops with at least 20 homers and 20 steals in three straight seasons . Jimmy Rollins has accomplished the feat four times
column18: but never three years in a row . 	 FAVORITE FOE 	 Harper has hit 10 of his 55 career homers against the Mets
column19: including four this year . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Nationals : Werth returned to the lineup after missing Friday 's game because of a bout with the flu and " dead legs
column20: " as Williams put it . ... Ryan Zimmerman plans to leave Sunday for the Florida instructional league so he can begin playing in games . Zimmerman has been on the disabled list since straining his right hamstring July 22 . He hopes to return before the regular season ends . 	 Mets : Daniel Murphy was back in the lineup at 3B. He sat out Friday after getting hit in the left wrist Thursday by a pitch from Nationals reliever Matt Thornton . ... Matt den Dekker sat out again and was scheduled to be re - examined by a doctor . The outfielder was hit by a pitch on his left hand Tuesday . " That hand is just not getting much better
column21: " Collins said . " He ca n't grip the bat yet . He 's having a tough time throwing . " 	 UP NEXT 	 Nationals RHP Jordan Zimmermann ( 11 - 5
column22: 2.93 ERA ) starts the series finale against LHP Jonathon Niese ( 8 - 10
column23: 3.59 ) . It will be Zimmermann 's 10th career start at Citi Field . Niese has not beaten the Nationals since August 2012 . 	 Detroit got a jump - start on the winter signings
